- Add python-novaclient for compute nodes to provide nova CLI

commit_message:
Fix live migration for File/Volume based Instances

- Open libvirt ports for migration http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/FAQ
- Add python-novaclient for compute nodes to provide nova CLI
- Change libvirt_disk_cachemodes to"file=directsync","block=none".

This allows live block migration, as DirectSync mode is like writethrough, but it bypasses the host page cache.

Closes-Bug: 1329953
Change-Id: Ie7cee823fac70f9c2dd46c04f8651cec6bddccc4

commit_message:
Exclude docker from the admin net masquerading

We should exclude -s docker0 form the nailgun iptables
rule for admin network masquerading in order to
elliminate the potential issues related with race condition
during master node deployment.

Closes-bug: #1332517

Change-Id: I942da109d83cce65880a3f27cb1d5301d300da50
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Avoid reading real config files in unit test
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 3012, 'name': 'Dina Belova', 'email': 'dbelova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbelova'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6676, 'name': 'zqfan', 'email': 'aji.zqfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'aji-zqfan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-18 04:18:03.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/compute/pollsters/base.py', 'ceilometer/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Avoid reading real config files in unit test

When we call oslo.config.cfg.CONF(), it will do basic setup and
search configuration files under certain directories, by default,
they are [/etc, /etc/ceilometer, ~/, ~/.ceilometer]. However, we
should avoid such behaviour when we run unit test code, because that
if the system has run devstack or installed ceilometer services,
then /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf will exist, then unit test result
can be different.

So we should mock the default searching directories of cfg in the
begining of all unit tests, which will call cfg.CONF() at somewhere
during the test. The best place to mock the default directories
can be ceilometer.test.base.BaseTestCase, which should be used as
parent class of all other test classes.

Note: since this patch sets default searching directory to
{repo}/etc/ceilometer, you can run the unit test with different settings
which are set in etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf (not tracked by git).

Note: mock.patch.stopall has compatibility problem with oslo.fixture,
so this patch slightly refactors the
tests.compute.pollsters.base.TestPollsterBase.setUp method.

Change-Id: I533ffb2ba2c9be0223cecbcf04176312e4a96369
Closes-Bug: #1328550
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid reading real config files in unit test

When we call oslo.config.cfg.CONF(), it will do basic setup and
search configuration files under certain directories, by default,
they are [/etc, /etc/ceilometer, ~/, ~/.ceilometer]. However, we
should avoid such behaviour when we run unit test code, because that
if the system has run devstack or installed ceilometer services,
then /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf will exist, then unit test result
can be different.

So we should mock the default searching directories of cfg in the
begining of all unit tests, which will call cfg.CONF() at somewhere
during the test. The best place to mock the default directories
can be ceilometer.test.base.BaseTestCase, which should be used as
parent class of all other test classes.

Note: since this patch sets default searching directory to
{repo}/etc/ceilometer, you can run the unit test with different settings
which are set in etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf (not tracked by git).

Note: mock.patch.stopall has compatibility problem with oslo.fixture,
so this patch slightly refactors the
tests.compute.pollsters.base.TestPollsterBase.setUp method.

Change-Id: I533ffb2ba2c9be0223cecbcf04176312e4a96369
Closes-Bug: #1328550

commit_message:
Fix object code direct use of other object modules

The object code itself should not explicitly reference its own objects,
as objects could be subclassed.

Also: There were a few objects that had their own __init__()s that
didn't support accepting 'context' or kwargs. At some point here, we
should also require that context is passed when instantiating the
objects. So, I added the (currently optional) context argument on some
object instantiations near the places I was touching.

Partial-Blueprint: object-subclassing

Change-Id: Icf631c770e347b4bb32999c4ba2431d1db49e11c

commit_message:
Sync loggers and handlers from Horizon upstream

In order to prevent too verbose logging, use recommended
patterns from upstream examples
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/2014.1.1/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example

Closes-bug: #1330825

Change-Id: Ie93816388d2bb97d6543c3452398ec15e5c8fd31

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-26 18:53:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py'], 'message': 'encoding error in file

There is a non-printable character (c2a0) in a comment line, which
in a new Neutron test case causes a StringException. There are
three issues here.

1) Encoding issue in the file.
2) No detection of encoding issues in files.
3) Neutron tests mask the failure detail

This addresses the first issue. Bug 1334798 in Neutron was created
for the last issue. Oslo team is aware of the second issue.

Related-Bug: #1334798

Change-Id: I8cfa6c93085a26666a8b4bee06dcd52709d04a95
'}]
commit_message:
encoding error in file

There is a non-printable character (c2a0) in a comment line, which
in a new Neutron test case causes a StringException. There are
three issues here.

1) Encoding issue in the file.
2) No detection of encoding issues in files.
3) Neutron tests mask the failure detail

This addresses the first issue. Bug 1334798 in Neutron was created
for the last issue. Oslo team is aware of the second issue.

Related-Bug: #1334798

Change-Id: I8cfa6c93085a26666a8b4bee06dcd52709d04a95

commit_message:
Use config generator rc instead of wrapper script

This commit removes the generate_sample wrapper script and adds an
rc file for the config generator to specify the alternate path.
This makes console messages from the generator tooling point
consistent with what is actually being used. Before because a wrapper
was used error messages would recommend running the incorrect tool.

Change-Id: I0ac792454777af6e3f1d718836031f9a14850229

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-25 16:44:16.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/plugins/hdp/versions/version_2_0_6/resources/ambari-config-resource.json', 'sahara/tests/unit/plugins/hdp/test_clusterspec_hdp2.py', 'sahara/plugins/hdp/versions/version_2_0_6/resources/default-cluster.template', 'sahara/plugins/hdp/versions/version_2_0_6/services.py', 'sahara/plugins/hdp/versions/version_2_0_6/versionhandler.py'], 'message': 'Upgrades the HDP plug-in to install Hue

Adds a HUE service definition to the set of defined services.  This service
  contains a HUE component defined to be a CLIENT allowing a single instance
  to be configured within a cluster.
Adds the following configuration groups to the set of defined configurations:
  hue-ini - contains configuration options used to build the hue.ini file to
            be deployed to the Hue node
  hue-core-site - contains parameters to add or update within the
                  core-site.xml file to be deployed on relevant nodes
  hue-hdfs-site - contains parameters to add or update within the

  hue-webhcat-site - contains parameters to add or update within the

  hue-oozie-site - contains parameters to add or update within the
                   oozie-site.xml file to be deployed on relevant nodes
Adds the HueService class to the set of Service classes. This class implements

  cluster (HIVE, OOZIE, WENHCHAT), ensure the required components are
  installed on the Hue node (HIVE_CLIENT), update relevant site configuration
  files (see above), generate a hue.ini file, install and configure Hue on the
  specified node
Updates the base Service class to include a new property - ambari_managed.
  This property is a Boolean value declaring whether a service is managed by
  Amberi (True) or not (False). The default value is True, since most services
  in the HDP are managed by Ambari. Ambari, Hue, and possibly services to be

Change-Id: Id3ff7a18aa1f65a733c637dc2ea4ce8f988165e4

commit_message:
Upgrades the HDP plug-in to install Hue

Adds a HUE service definition to the set of defined services.  This service
  contains a HUE component defined to be a CLIENT allowing a single instance
  to be configured within a cluster.
Adds the following configuration groups to the set of defined configurations:
  hue-ini - contains configuration options used to build the hue.ini file to
            be deployed to the Hue node
  hue-core-site - contains parameters to add or update within the
                  core-site.xml file to be deployed on relevant nodes
  hue-hdfs-site - contains parameters to add or update within the
                  hdfs-site.xml file to be deployed on relevant nodes
  hue-webhcat-site - contains parameters to add or update within the
                     webhcat-site.xml file to be deployed on relevant nodes
  hue-oozie-site - contains parameters to add or update within the
                   oozie-site.xml file to be deployed on relevant nodes
Adds the HueService class to the set of Service classes. This class implements
  Service to validate that the required services are to be installed in the
  cluster (HIVE, OOZIE, WENHCHAT), ensure the required components are
  installed on the Hue node (HIVE_CLIENT), update relevant site configuration
  files (see above), generate a hue.ini file, install and configure Hue on the
  specified node
Updates the base Service class to include a new property - ambari_managed.
  This property is a Boolean value declaring whether a service is managed by
  Amberi (True) or not (False). The default value is True, since most services
  in the HDP are managed by Ambari. Ambari, Hue, and possibly services to be
  added in the future are not; thus this property is used to generalize logic
  in the HDP plug-in.

Implements: blueprint hdp-plugin-hue-support

Under eventlet if the client disconnects while Keystone is trying

exhausted.

commit_message:
Do not log 14+ INFO lines on a broken pipe error (eventlet)

Under eventlet if the client disconnects while Keystone is trying
to transmit data, approximately 14 lines of traceback are logged.

This could result in massive logs if done repeatedly; worst case
scenario could include a denial of service due to disk space being
exhausted.

Change-Id: Iaf14c64799daa7539d1bd85cb6c6457380c111d9
Closes-Bug: #1334466

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-26 19:19:57.000000000', 'files': ['shotgun/shotgun/driver.py', 'shotgun/shotgun/utils.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/settings.yaml'], 'message': 'Shotgun: make snapshot of entire /var/log

Shootgun uses a fabric.api.get method to download some folder from the
remote host. Unfortunately, this method has a bug and fails when we
trying to download a folder that contains a symlink to another one.

So we need to patch fabric api to prevent us from such falls. The issue
with fabric api is that it recognize all symlinks as a file. As a result
we fails when trying to download a folder (pointed by a symlink)  as
a file.

The patch was proposed to the fabric master branch and can be reviewed
here:

    https://github.com/fabric/fabric/pull/1147

Closes-Bug: #1318514
Closes-Bug: #1323436

Change-Id: Ic2ae889337e5da15bbdf83338b8e8d5d913aeb63
'}]
commit_message:
Shotgun: make snapshot of entire /var/log

Shootgun uses a fabric.api.get method to download some folder from the
remote host. Unfortunately, this method has a bug and fails when we
trying to download a folder that contains a symlink to another one.

So we need to patch fabric api to prevent us from such falls. The issue
with fabric api is that it recognize all symlinks as a file. As a result
we fails when trying to download a folder (pointed by a symlink)  as
a file.

The patch was proposed to the fabric master branch and can be reviewed
here:

    https://github.com/fabric/fabric/pull/1147

Closes-Bug: #1318514
Closes-Bug: #1323436

Change-Id: Ic2ae889337e5da15bbdf83338b8e8d5d913aeb63

commit_message:
Make sure domains are enabled by default

Domains without an explicit 'enabled' key in the dict will now be
handled in the same way as projects are. This will ensure that
the KVS backend produces the same result as the SQL backend for
assignment.

Change-Id: I3b6d26278329841cfe1be5ce7f67ba6d3569785f
Related-Bug: #1311142

commit_message:
Implemented S3 multi-part upload functionality

Adding large images to glance now uses the S3 MultiPart Upload REST API.
Added a unit test to upload images of various sizes to trigger the usage
of the S3 Multipart Upload API and ensure that it is being exercised.

DocImpact: The following parameters are added in glance-api.conf
+# Size, in MB, should S3 start chunking image files
+# and do a multipart upload in S3. The default is 100MB.
+#s3_store_large_object_size = 100
+
+# Multipart upload part size, in MB, should S3 use when uploading
+# parts. The size must be greater than or equal to
+# 5MB. The default is 10MB.
+#s3_store_large_object_chunk_size = 10
+
+# The number of thread pools to perform a multipart upload
+# in S3. The default is 10.
+#s3_store_thread_pools = 10

Implements: blueprint s3-multi-part-upload
Change-Id: I36e28e7944e57cd7ac05e46afac461ec10245c68

On kernels >= 3.13 for Ubuntu, there is no need to install the
openvswitch-datapath-dkms package anymore. Consequently we don't need the
dkms package anymore, nor the linux headers.

Update the opendaylight devstack code to correctly check for this and make

commit_message:
Don't install openvswitch-datapath-dkms on newer kernels

On kernels >= 3.13 for Ubuntu, there is no need to install the
openvswitch-datapath-dkms package anymore. Consequently we don't need the
dkms package anymore, nor the linux headers.

Update the opendaylight devstack code to correctly check for this and make
the right decision.

While here, also utilize get_packages() and common code where possible.

Change-Id: Idd6a71951f6f77b6e3c4e536e735dfead6a40bc1
Closes-Bug: #1331111

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-26 15:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['tools/integration.sh'], 'message': 'Update integration script for Apache 2.4

Apache 2.4 requires site configuration files to have a ".conf"
extension, and Apache 2.2 does not want the extension. Add logic to
figure out the right name for the file so we can run the tests against
both versions of Apache.

Fixes bug: #1334326

the python build deps. Without this we can get cryptic library
compilation issues.

And use ccache explicitly

into this one because we can't move forward without both.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

'}]
commit_message:
Update integration script for Apache 2.4

Apache 2.4 requires site configuration files to have a ".conf"
extension, and Apache 2.2 does not want the extension. Add logic to
figure out the right name for the file so we can run the tests against
both versions of Apache.

Fixes bug: #1334326

install required libraries for mixed c things

use build-dep to install the required libraries needed for
the python build deps. Without this we can get cryptic library
compilation issues.

And use ccache explicitly

Change-Id: Ia750e4221b119097521cf373752aae364759913b squashed
into this one because we can't move forward without both.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: I5ab8898bd3cc2de18681fe3262cb784f7d9519ab

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-15 21:50:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova-compute-config.yaml', 'nova-compute-instance.yaml', 'overcloud-source.yaml'], 'message': 'Move address fetching to configs

Address lookups are expensive. Rather than resolving this runtime data

Change-Id: I38a0ec106baf392ae8078fab173a65ac94984f36
'}]
commit_message:
Move address fetching to configs

Address lookups are expensive. Rather than resolving this runtime data
with each deployment, we want to inject them into the config object once.

Change-Id: I38a0ec106baf392ae8078fab173a65ac94984f36

Ensure cache mount directory exists before its used. The zypper element
would error when attempting to mount the cache directory because the
mount point did not exist. This patch corrects that.

Change-Id: Iaa3c2a0254b12bd847643a61a99f5a234097fd21

commit_message:
Ensure cache directory exists before use

Ensure cache mount directory exists before its used. The zypper element
would error when attempting to mount the cache directory because the
mount point did not exist. This patch corrects that.

Change-Id: Iaa3c2a0254b12bd847643a61a99f5a234097fd21

Scripts in pre-install.d run as root so there is no need to sudo commands.

commit_message:
update zypper element

Scripts in pre-install.d run as root so there is no need to sudo commands.
This patch also helps avoid an error when sudo is not installed in the
default image.

Change-Id: Iab20edfb161189f8c4e0cfa7d6946f63163d6413

subject: Update projname-normalization regex
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-25 00:50:45.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Update projname-normalization regex

As of I3e2b1b0bc5871e4ec4ffd8117906cd077aa2cb0d 98-source-repositories
updated the regex it uses to normalize the project names, as it turns
out there are more characters that need to be stripped out than just -
and .

This change updates toci_devtest.sh to match what
98-source-repositories does.

Change-Id: I1c4841610bbc8a5487beba47223efdf567f618f5
'}]
commit_message:
Update projname-normalization regex

As of I3e2b1b0bc5871e4ec4ffd8117906cd077aa2cb0d 98-source-repositories
updated the regex it uses to normalize the project names, as it turns
out there are more characters that need to be stripped out than just -
and .

This change updates toci_devtest.sh to match what
98-source-repositories does.

Change-Id: I1c4841610bbc8a5487beba47223efdf567f618f5

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-25 22:03:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py'], 'message': 'Use default rpc_response_timeout in unit tests

During running of tox the system can timeout on slower systems.
We have seen this occur in our internal tests and have seen
better results when we increased the api timeout from 15 to 60
seconds.  This can be used until faster hardware is availale
or a better fix is proposed.  Andrew Laski first proposed
this fix.

Closes-Bug: 1311778

Change-Id: I33da328e7bea8fbdde3f01ee0147b4c5a3a278d2
'}]
commit_message:
Use default rpc_response_timeout in unit tests

During running of tox the system can timeout on slower systems.
We have seen this occur in our internal tests and have seen
better results when we increased the api timeout from 15 to 60
seconds.  This can be used until faster hardware is availale
or a better fix is proposed.  Andrew Laski first proposed
this fix.

Closes-Bug: 1311778

Change-Id: I33da328e7bea8fbdde3f01ee0147b4c5a3a278d2

commit_message:
service_instance: Add lock to creation of security_group

service_instance module, that is used by generic driver
does not have lock for creation of security_group.
This causes concurrent creation of security groups
in multibackend installation.

Change-Id: I00c1ab8a35bed3da3e46c20ffaf220cde26f7fcd
Closes-Bug: #1334598

Changes service vm network connectivity

Service vm will be connected directly to private subnet
by additional interface instead of connection thru router
from service subnet.

commit_message:
Fuelmenu cleanup for settings and interfaces

Excludes docker* and veth* interfaces from
being configurable. Naily facts are removed
from fuelmenu completely.
Update astute.yaml path to /etc/fuel

Closes-Bug: #1323369

commit_message:
Set the API host to the same ip as SERVICE_HOST

This is for a number of reasons:
- it should be the same as what is published in keystone endpoint
- when we use CONF.builder.host from pipeline_handler we need an IP we can
  connect to, not 0.0.0.0

Also updated the functional test checker.

Change-Id: If2510758bccda55e305f2d17403b8e608180bd66

commit_message:
Fix authentication from the auth_ref

1) Populate token_info in the AuthInformationHook
2) don't re-authenticate if we have auth_ref
3) set the token.id from the context for v2 tokens

Change-Id: Ice017dc42292c3fb5ddc062d064485389e082a63

Some important changes for service filtering to support resources:
* Support the notion of ANY service_type in the service filter for
  user preferences.
* Create a join method in ServiceFilter to join a resource
  filter with a user preference.
* Support service filter preference in session.

For example if a user wanted to use region='East' they would create
a service filter preference in their session with that region and
use that session with any resource.

Change-Id: I13fc2838b66ec85bdd0191c78b27b3cd685a8322
"}]
commit_message:
Important changes for service filtering

Some important changes for service filtering to support resources:
* Support the notion of ANY service_type in the service filter for
  user preferences.
* Create a join method in ServiceFilter to join a resource
  filter with a user preference.
* Support service filter preference in session.

For example if a user wanted to use region='East' they would create
a service filter preference in their session with that region and
use that session with any resource.

Change-Id: I13fc2838b66ec85bdd0191c78b27b3cd685a8322

commit_message:
Add CM signing directory for keystone client

Adding a signing directory for ceilometer-api
to avoid the performance issues created by keystone
client use of temp directory (default behavior when
not specified).

Addresses bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-keystoneclient/+bug/1180998

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-26 10:08:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "effectively disable libvirt live snapshotting

As being seen in the gate, libvirt 1.2.2 doesn't appear to actually
handle live snapshotting under any appreciable load (possibly
related to parallel operations). It isn't a 100% failure, but it's
currently being hit in a large number of runs.

Effectively turn this off by increasing the
MIN_LIBVIRT_LIVESNAPSHOT_VERSION to something that doesn't yet
exist. This can get us back to a working state, then we can decide
if live snapshotting is something that can be made to actually work
under load.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1334398

Change-Id: I9908b743df2093c8dd2723af89be51630eafc99f
"}]
commit_message:
effectively disable libvirt live snapshotting

As being seen in the gate, libvirt 1.2.2 doesn't appear to actually
handle live snapshotting under any appreciable load (possibly
related to parallel operations). It isn't a 100% failure, but it's
currently being hit in a large number of runs.

Effectively turn this off by increasing the
MIN_LIBVIRT_LIVESNAPSHOT_VERSION to something that doesn't yet
exist. This can get us back to a working state, then we can decide
if live snapshotting is something that can be made to actually work
under load.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1334398

Change-Id: I9908b743df2093c8dd2723af89be51630eafc99f

commit_message:
Fixing hardcoded glance protocol

glance protocol was hardcoded as "http".
But someone may be use https for glance like us.

We are already have configuration for glance protocol.
So we should use it.

Change-Id: Iebde9efa5c4bb531b5b8a80061d98ccc360b622c
Closes-Bug: 1334489

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-06-25 20:15:47.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'soft-qemu handling with F20 could image

When the qume used with Linux image without
a para-virtualized timer, various timing issues can happen,
if the qemu process preempted in the wrong time, for example
at timer test.

The issues less like happens on low load, high core number
host system, but it can happen.

For soft qemu (TCG) generally recommended to explicitly disable the
timer check.

Pre-caching the Fedora `gate edition` image, which contains the
the no_timers_check option.

Related-Bug: #1297560
Partial-Bug: #1312199

Change-Id: Id5cd01a92a047b7859914e5bb017c15ee443b4d5'}]
commit_message:
soft-qemu handling with F20 could image

When the qume used with Linux image without
a para-virtualized timer, various timing issues can happen,
if the qemu process preempted in the wrong time, for example
at timer test.

The issues less like happens on low load, high core number
host system, but it can happen.

For soft qemu (TCG) generally recommended to explicitly disable the
timer check.

Pre-caching the Fedora `gate edition` image, which contains the
the no_timers_check option.

Related-Bug: #1297560
Partial-Bug: #1312199

Change-Id: Id5cd01a92a047b7859914e5bb017c15ee443b4d5

commit_message:
nova-notifs: allow to use secure keystone endpoint

When getting the nova_admin_tenant_id, the provider is now able to
connect to Keystone by using a SSL endpoint.

Closes-bug #1334250

Change-Id: Ifa3399ec6721c99e4610d75dfb46e570d015d112
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Add details of which OS releases are tested in CI

We still find people trying to run test environments on older versions,
particularly Ubuntu Precise.

This release specifically mentions that we test on Ubuntu/Fedora 20
hosts with Trusty or Fedora20 guests.

Change-Id: Id1cd6c8771e67ce849f671b1148631ea7c3abcef

commit_message:
mdns: Add support for NOTIFY's

designate-mdns will be notified by Central when changes are made
to a zone. The service will issue a NOTIFY to all slave nameservers.

Currently this is a pre-configured list of slaves to NOTIFY.  After
Pools, the list of slaves to NOTIFY will be loaded dynamically.

Change-Id: Iead2287f79726eddbb225538de961332cda49f24
Implements: blueprint mdns-designate-mdns-notify

commit_message:
Fix version display position on system info page

Current the version info position is absolute, so it may cover On
the table when there are lots of items in the table. Fix this by
making the version info relative.

Change-Id: I82cf36a6a50ff790f954aeee83ab2e4d61eadd69
Closes-bug: 1331685

commit_message:
remove support for Fedora

We're not supporting the Fedora platform. Get rid of the Fedora-specific
code and especially the tests which would fail unless they are
maintained going forward.

Change-Id: Ia876314b72777d591471a605d44fec01ae459438

commit_message:
Deprecate and remove agent_build_get_by_triple()

This method was only used in the xenapi driver, which has since been
converted to use Objects. This removes the call from VirtAPI, the
conductor API, and deprecates it from conductor manager.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I43b8c4bc201361ce79d56cac91a8944d18c03ab2

commit_message:
Object-ify xenapi driver's use of agent_build_get_by_triple()

This makes the xenapi driver use the new Agent object instead of
making a VirtAPI/conductor raw call back to the database.

Related to blueprint virt-objects-juno

Change-Id: I8498c6f3e2fa5d614ac301402d2be778e5edb74e

commit_message:
Add dogtag plugin to new plugin structure

This patch adds the dogtag plugin (and tests) to the new plugin
structure under plugins/ and converts the plugin to an implementation
of the SecretStore interface.

The old dogtag_crypto_plugin will be retained until the top level
plugin manager and resources have been switched over, allowing us to
fully test the new dogtag plugin.

Change-Id: I20e2daca6dad2339d228e850a03868ac587089c0

implementation in the Pecan WSGI application constructor.  Detect support for

commit_message:
Don't monkeypatch pecan.core.Request in newer versions of pecan

An upcoming version of pecan will allow you to specify a custom pecan.request
implementation in the Pecan WSGI application constructor.  Detect support for
this functionality and attempt to utilize it instead of the current
monkeypatching approach.

Change-Id: Ie3c257d0cf0618c20af2b834a9ec9698534d23c5

subject: Fix inconsistent inline help text in forms
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 2455, 'name': 'Tihomir Trifonov', 'email': 't.trifonov@gmail.com', 'username': 'ttrifonov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 18:02:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/less/horizon.less', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.forms.js', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_form_fields.html'], 'message': "Fix inconsistent inline help text in forms

Currently, help text is only shown for some input fields.
For example, if you go to 'Launch Instance', click on
the input field 'Instance Count' to see the help tooltip.
It is not displayed for checkboxes (BooleanFields) or dropdown menu,
even though help_text is provided in the code.

This change places a small 'info' icon beside each label (if help_text
is defined for that django form element) so that when you hover over it,
it will show you the corresponding help text.

This patch provides a uniform solution for all field and allows to user to
immediately see which fields have help.

Change-Id: Ie2d85503160071ba4062b3368e2ef79e7786343e
Closes-Bug: #1332738
Closes-Bug: #1330766
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistent inline help text in forms

Currently, help text is only shown for some input fields.
For example, if you go to 'Launch Instance', click on
the input field 'Instance Count' to see the help tooltip.
It is not displayed for checkboxes (BooleanFields) or dropdown menu,
even though help_text is provided in the code.

This change places a small 'info' icon beside each label (if help_text
is defined for that django form element) so that when you hover over it,
it will show you the corresponding help text.

This patch provides a uniform solution for all field and allows to user to
immediately see which fields have help.

Change-Id: Ie2d85503160071ba4062b3368e2ef79e7786343e
Closes-Bug: #1332738
Closes-Bug: #1330766

commit_message:
Sync necessary modules from oslo incubator for worker service

Sync modelus: service, periodic_task and related dependencies
from oslo-incubator. Using the following command in oslo-incubator:

python update.py --base rally --dest-dir ../rally --modules \
periodic_task,service

Change-Id: I0b8278404d53a91add7a8cf3876121aad1e497c2

commit_message:
install required libraries for mixed c things

use build-dep to install the required libraries needed for
the python build deps. Without this we can get cryptic library
compilation issues.

commit_message:
remove token from notifier middleware

notifier middleware is capturing token and sending it to MQ. this
is not advisable so we should filter it out.

Change-Id: Ia1bfa1bd24989681db1d2f385defc12e69a01f8d
Closes-Bug: #1321080

commit_message:
Set default metadata backlog to 4096

We already optimize the metadata agent by running it in multi-workers,
we need by default to set the metadata backlog value.
Inspired from 19:34: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AF9r_VQrcJ0
and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95372

Change-Id: I68f3414ef56290ca27d11f8cf26febc100741d46
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1055a125eb767d08028ab9818e4bbc2fb0009303)

commit_message:
remove unnided CIB definition for some OCF resources (part #2)

Heat, Celiometer

Pacemaker resources will created only at deploy primary controller.
At this stage we do not need pacemaker shadow mechanick, because
we have only one running cluster node.

For bunch of pacemaker resources using shadows is a unnecessarily.

Blueprint: ha-pacemaker-improvements
Closes-Bug: #1283062

Change-Id: I25507e335643af2acfb76f0ae29e2b69fab9cb68

commit_message:
remove unnided CIB definition for some OCF resources (part #1)

Pacemaker resources will created only at deploy primary controller.
At this stage we do not need pacemaker shadow mechanick, because
we have only one running cluster node.

For bunch of pacemaker resources using shadows is a unnecessarily.

Blueprint: ha-pacemaker-improvements
Closes-Bug: #1283062

Change-Id: Iead6d37b6050905dba6042c4d58aafeb6d614664

commit_message:
Do not create admin user if it exists already

In case if Keystone set to use some external authentication backend
(for example, LDAP), the admin user may already be pre-configured.
Need to avoid user creation in case if it exists already.

Change-Id: I06365619f5f21ef91b8de6fccefa13e56dc29d1c

subject: Add multi-region support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6754, 'name': 'Mark T. Voelker', 'email': 'markvoelker@gmail.com', 'username': 'mvoelker'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 13:07:26.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb'], 'message': "Add multi-region support

If only one region is available then the Neutron CLI will just pick the
only one available.  However, if more than one is available, then it
will error out about ambiguous region.  This patch extends the base
provider code to parse out the nova_region_name when it's parsing out
the keystone credentials and define the OS_REGION_NAME environment
variable when calling neutron, if the nova_region_name variable exists
in the config file.

Closes-Bug: #1329552
Change-Id: Ic0d59dcb02a11e93e8fad1e0e2ea830fb0dcccc7
(cherry picked from commit d1235d762b96e36b67180ee06929e36c81efd617)
"}]
commit_message:
Add multi-region support

If only one region is available then the Neutron CLI will just pick the
only one available.  However, if more than one is available, then it
will error out about ambiguous region.  This patch extends the base
provider code to parse out the nova_region_name when it's parsing out
the keystone credentials and define the OS_REGION_NAME environment
variable when calling neutron, if the nova_region_name variable exists
in the config file.

Closes-Bug: #1329552
Change-Id: Ic0d59dcb02a11e93e8fad1e0e2ea830fb0dcccc7
(cherry picked from commit d1235d762b96e36b67180ee06929e36c81efd617)

commit_message:
Fix test regression: each statement isn't correctly used here.

Spotted by Michael on review #93111, The ruby "each" statement
run each test twice with the same parameters. This commit clean
tests.

This is a standalone commit because the original change 8156a87
was already reviewed/merged into master.

Change-Id: I16280d501bcfeb435326094043395013a1fd365a

commit_message:
Use right complete spelling for DAC

The complete spelling for DAC is discretionary access control(not
Directory Access Control), which is commonly discussed in contrast to
mandatory access control.

Change-Id: Ic2c9d4565afa1aa1794cb02a123c859498ae7545
Closes-Bug: #1332587

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-26 11:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/samples/tasks/neutron/create_and_list_routers.yaml', 'tests/doc/test_task_samples.py', 'doc/samples/tasks/neutron/create_and_list_networks.yaml', 'doc/samples/tasks/keystone/create-and-list-tenants.yaml', 'doc/samples/tasks/neutron/create_and_list_ports.yaml', 'doc/samples/tasks/neutron/create_and_list_subnets.yaml', 'doc/samples/tasks/vm/boot-runcommand-delete.yaml'], 'message': 'Added a test to check json<->yaml configs equality

Implemented a unit test that takes all the config pairs from doc/samples/tasks/
with identical names (e.g. nova/boot-and-delete.json and
nova/boot-and-delete.yaml) and checks that their contents are identical as
well. Also it tests that every config should have a pair (if there is *.json,
there also has to be *.yaml, and vice versa)

Change-Id: I4c0d185439e2a2c48a801fa8c62c7ed2e80a6031
'}]
commit_message:
Added a test to check json<->yaml configs equality

Implemented a unit test that takes all the config pairs from doc/samples/tasks/
with identical names (e.g. nova/boot-and-delete.json and
nova/boot-and-delete.yaml) and checks that their contents are identical as
well. Also it tests that every config should have a pair (if there is *.json,
there also has to be *.yaml, and vice versa)

Change-Id: I4c0d185439e2a2c48a801fa8c62c7ed2e80a6031

commit_message:
Avoid race condition with hostname declaration

When we remove nodes from Cobbler, we lose access to this
node using hostnames.

Change-Id: Ic52cbd7562db91b9ea01fab30c56054c5253a93b
Related-Bug: #1316583
(cherry picked from commit 1829a9adbe69cc1b50403929a737cadbcbbba0ec)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 23:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/settings.py'], 'message': 'Make security rules with All translatable

The security rule names that include the word "All" should be
translatable.  I've included a SECURITY_GROUP_RULES value with
the 3 translatable rules from local_settings.py.example so that
we will actually have translations for those values.

Change-Id: Id21ac0e6ea328ab18f35f7711de356015db5f50a
Closes-bug: #1334031
'}]
commit_message:
Make security rules with All translatable

The security rule names that include the word "All" should be
translatable.  I've included a SECURITY_GROUP_RULES value with
the 3 translatable rules from local_settings.py.example so that
we will actually have translations for those values.

Change-Id: Id21ac0e6ea328ab18f35f7711de356015db5f50a
Closes-bug: #1334031

The aim of this blueprint is to improve the filter
`AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation`

An operator wants to schedule instances for a specific image
on a pre-defined group of hosts. In addition, he wants to
strictly isolate this group of hosts for the image only.

commit_message:
Strictly isolate group of hosts for an image

The aim of this blueprint is to improve the filter
`AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation`

An operator wants to schedule instances for a specific image
on a pre-defined group of hosts. In addition, he wants to
strictly isolate this group of hosts for the image only.

blueprint restrict-image-isolation-with-defined-keys
Change-Id: I98ee9a09b694abda0df7ddf8f95cf9e23b162372

subject: Let devstack automatically pick FLAT_INTERFACE
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-26 10:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/localrc.rc'], 'message': 'Let devstack automatically pick FLAT_INTERFACE

The FLAT_INTERFACE was previously incorrectly being set to br100,
but was being ignored by nova. However nova recently fixed a bug
(I92ee96e3aa34f7cd154a8ce4b33852b96cabe8c9) and now this is being
checked, resulting in "NovaException: Failed to add interface: device
br100 is a bridge device itself; can't enslave a bridge device to
a bridge device." when a nova instance is being provisioned.

This was causing an issue with running int-tests, since we were
unable to spin up nova instances.

Change-Id: Ifb78978693c7d646fe357fe8979606468c945653
'}]
commit_message:
Let devstack automatically pick FLAT_INTERFACE

The FLAT_INTERFACE was previously incorrectly being set to br100,
but was being ignored by nova. However nova recently fixed a bug
(I92ee96e3aa34f7cd154a8ce4b33852b96cabe8c9) and now this is being
checked, resulting in "NovaException: Failed to add interface: device
br100 is a bridge device itself; can't enslave a bridge device to
a bridge device." when a nova instance is being provisioned.

This was causing an issue with running int-tests, since we were
unable to spin up nova instances.

Change-Id: Ifb78978693c7d646fe357fe8979606468c945653

commit_message:
Add a virt driver for Ironic

This specification proposes to add a virt driver to enable
Nova to deploy images to bare metal resources by using the
OpenStack Bare Metal Provisioning Service ("Ironic").

Change-Id: I585754dd5c11a97a4eef01819387ce37b9a6a8b3

commit_message:
Replaced yaml.dump/load with yamlutils versions

Just covering a few missed cases after the creation of
yamlutils. A side effect of yaml.dump was causing the client
to fail to parse the raw_content of a plan immediately after
creation.

Change-Id: I68a9559a85c4c29d7a443f998dc94b644f0eeb9e

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 remote_consoles API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Icdb1f87903e3c4345e6533c08b2f2d2f9d36316e

commit_message:
Support Keystone V3 API

Keystone API v2 is deprecated in Icehouse. All
projects client need to switch to v3 API at end of
Juno. We should add v3 support in python-heatclient.

commit_message:
Blueprint for migrating non-active instances

Currently only instances in ACTIVE state can be live-migrated. This blueprint
proposes a scheme to live-migrate VMs in other stable states in a libvirt setup.

Implements: blueprint migrate-non-active-instances

Change-Id: I61bc883bb04b978d870877c36705001e80268751

commit_message:
Exclude security group related quotas when the extension disabled

When using neutron as network service and security group extension
disabled, the quotas update workflow will hit some error, because
'security_group' and 'security_group_rule' are passed to the quotas
update method for neutron.
This patch fixes the problem by excluding these two quotas when
neutron security group extension is disabled.

Change-Id: I0011e1c0956d3248b748f109d5ab5e93ec55f7d3
Closes-bug: 1330632

subject: Fix test to not assume eventlet isn't present
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-25 20:35:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_concurrency.py'], 'message': "Fix test to not assume eventlet isn't present

The test suite TpoolDbapiWrapperTestCase makes a blanket assumption
that the test environment does not have eventlet installed; it
places a mock object into sys.modules in order to take the place
of eventlet.   The test_db_api_without_installed_eventlet however
deletes this mock, assuming that subsequent access will raise an
ImportError.  The change is to instead place None in this dictionary
so that an ImportError is guaranteed regardless of whether or not
eventlet is actually installed in the environment.

Change-Id: I7b5b7c0d20581f8ecfa319f3cfa0f48112bc86b9
Closes-Bug: #1334427
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test to not assume eventlet isn't present

The test suite TpoolDbapiWrapperTestCase makes a blanket assumption
that the test environment does not have eventlet installed; it
places a mock object into sys.modules in order to take the place
of eventlet.   The test_db_api_without_installed_eventlet however
deletes this mock, assuming that subsequent access will raise an
ImportError.  The change is to instead place None in this dictionary
so that an ImportError is guaranteed regardless of whether or not
eventlet is actually installed in the environment.

Change-Id: I7b5b7c0d20581f8ecfa319f3cfa0f48112bc86b9
Closes-Bug: #1334427

This patch adds list of security group rules as an attribute to
AWS security group resource to allow getting their properties
as currently security group rules
are not resources in Heat themselves.

The output for both Nova-network and Neutron security groups

commit_message:
Add 'Rules' attribute to AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup

This patch adds list of security group rules as an attribute to
AWS security group resource to allow getting their properties
as currently security group rules
are not resources in Heat themselves.

The output for both Nova-network and Neutron security groups
is converted to a common style (more resembling Nova-network
and closer to resource properties names).

Change-Id: Ia4fd7a6a291ea18d389b7484229908a376dd8cc4

commit_message:
Don't allow "propagate" of cinderclient logger

Unlike other project, if we specified "--debug" in cinderclient, it will
display duplicate debug info. This is because the "propagate" of
cinderclient logger is True as default.

Change-Id: Ie3df3678ac2b16c6dad3ed03d29894838e690070
Closes-Bug: #1320789

commit_message:
Implements: Vmware driver
Closes-Bug: #1314034
The original instance['name'] is not the VM name in vCenter.
In IceHouse and later, the VM name in vCenter has the same
value of uuid.

Change-Id: Ib61e00639585a9ac3df207760c6c44f6edfa140e

commit_message:
Move allocation ratios to resource tracker

Proposal to move the allocation ratio definitions out of the scheduler
filters and into the resource tracker, and move the calculation of
available resources (with overcommit ratio) into the host manager in the
scheduler instead of in the filters themselves

Change-Id: Ic3c3029cf48177e050da2b4a9bb49a21906d82db
Blueprint: allocation-ratio-to-resource-tracker

commit_message:
Drop some unnecessary lsb_release calls

Since Ib4b05eb7191dd50d25799a0bac51fd15c01b74cb, it's possible to know
the Operating System name with the $DISTRO_NAME environment variable.

This patch makes use of this variable when it's possible.

Change-Id: I3252fb60c8bfcc2859ea4b5b138f5888638aaf3c

Closes-Bug: #1264424

commit_message:
Add keyword argument missing at some exc.HTTPError subclass

Some exc.HTTPError subclass needs keyword argument ``explanation``.
If there is no ``explanation=``, the message of the argument is
recognized as ``detail``.

Change-Id: Idfc07b2bd71da31e44212d3296921e18d2024a63
Closes-Bug: #1264424

commit_message:
libvirt: add '_' prefix to some get_host_* methods

The get_host_uuid, get_host_capabilities and get_host_cpu_for_guest
methods are all internal helpers so should have a '_' prefix to
indicate they are not part of public virt driver API.

Related-bug: #1333219
Change-Id: Ice22f52ef1f4ec0b950b5fdf303499ea5c2ba7be

commit_message:
VMware: remove dsutil.split_datastore_path

The functionality of split_datatore_path has been subsumed by
the DatastorePath utility class, so remove it and convert
all callers to use the latter.

Change-Id: I07a2cfe15fccaca4aee25bc43157e6c604b91831

Part of spawn refactor work to consolidate a lot of the datastore path
manipulation code. The DatastorePath class is a simpler version of a
class of the same name in earlier versions of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87002, and is intentionally limited in
the ways that DatastorePath objects can be constructed. No attempts are
made to ensure that the datastore, directories and files referenced in
these objects are valid on the remote system.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Change-Id: Id65d0308d32835048229e7a3d98b84af2b13583c
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: spawn refactor - DatastorePath class

Part of spawn refactor work to consolidate a lot of the datastore path
manipulation code. The DatastorePath class is a simpler version of a
class of the same name in earlier versions of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87002, and is intentionally limited in
the ways that DatastorePath objects can be constructed. No attempts are
made to ensure that the datastore, directories and files referenced in
these objects are valid on the remote system.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Change-Id: Id65d0308d32835048229e7a3d98b84af2b13583c

subject: List projects not restricted to pypi.openstack.org
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-26 04:58:04.000000000', 'files': ['pip_fallback_allowed.txt'], 'message': 'List projects not restricted to pypi.openstack.org

Currently, projects listed in projects.txt are not allowed to use
pip to download requirements from pypi.python.org, and are limited
only to pypi.openstack.org. This patch adds an exception list
where stackforge projects can be listed that will be allowed to
fall back to using pypi.python.org for any requirements not found
in pypi.openstack.org.

See also: https://review.openstack.org/102716

Change-Id: I7b32c7ec2a6c03f104619d81c353424412db41f9
'}]
commit_message:
List projects not restricted to pypi.openstack.org

Currently, projects listed in projects.txt are not allowed to use
pip to download requirements from pypi.python.org, and are limited
only to pypi.openstack.org. This patch adds an exception list
where stackforge projects can be listed that will be allowed to
fall back to using pypi.python.org for any requirements not found
in pypi.openstack.org.

See also: https://review.openstack.org/102716

Change-Id: I7b32c7ec2a6c03f104619d81c353424412db41f9

Hacking 0.9.0 had a minor bug so require 0.9.2 or higher.

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.9.x

Hacking 0.9.0 had a minor bug so require 0.9.2 or higher.

In order to keep this patch to just a requirements bump, ignore new and
stricter hacking rules that are being triggered. Fixing up the code and
turning these on is out of scope of this patch and is for future patches.

Change-Id: I64f46c92e49625a519c902d402be94c914c50816

commit_message:
use /etc/trove/conf.d for guest agent config

The existing /etc/guest_info location is too generic.
/etc/trove is better for this trove specific info.
Also conf.d/ is better for config dropped from outside
the guestagent package.  Also this is the location of
the example guest_info file provided.

Change-Id: I34e5506ce6b267338d15e7a98761c84d6904e897

commit_message:
Add missing AMQP options to glance-api.conf

Add more AMQP and QPID configuration options
to the glance-api configuration file. This enables
users to use QPID federation support and also
use durable queues for rabbitmq or QPID.

Change-Id: I2bdc0f713c7363966a192bfce9b59b3f312532d1

subject: Fix the crontab entry for keystone-manage token_flush
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1032, 'name': 'Justin Shepherd', 'email': 'jshepher@rackspace.com', 'username': 'jshepher'}, {'_account_id': 5371, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'email': 'locke105@gmail.com', 'username': 'locke105'}, {'_account_id': 7128, 'name': 'Mark Vanderwiel', 'email': 'vanderwl@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kramvan'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-25 11:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['spec/server_spec.rb', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': "Fix the crontab entry for keystone-manage token_flush

I'm confused by the use of

  `which foo` --args

since if which is able to find `foo`, so is the shell, hence

  foo --args

should be equivalent.

Also, echoing the exit code $? when run with && is not interesting, it
will always be 0.  Now, a failure will be reported, too.

Changed the format slightly to get rid of the %Q{} worries.

Change-Id: I39116496747d58fd816201d07713377bb193fc8f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the crontab entry for keystone-manage token_flush

I'm confused by the use of

  `which foo` --args

since if which is able to find `foo`, so is the shell, hence

  foo --args

should be equivalent.

Also, echoing the exit code $? when run with && is not interesting, it
will always be 0.  Now, a failure will be reported, too.

Changed the format slightly to get rid of the %Q{} worries.

Change-Id: I39116496747d58fd816201d07713377bb193fc8f

commit_message:
Use ebtables to isolate dhcp traffic

Iptables doesn't properly block the broadcast traffic crossing
the bridge, so use ebtables instead. Removes test which is no
longer valid since we are not using iptables anymore.

Change-Id: I43e5f1fe9512dd3ec9595c7203bc46837cef3cad
Closes-Bug: #1318104

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-25 21:32:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py'], 'message': 'OVS agent: Correct bridge setup ordering

This patch fixes three issues that combined to break tunnel networks.

The first issue was the the failure mode was being set on the
integration bridge after the canary flow was installed. This
immediately wiped out the canary flow.

The second problem was that the main loop would sync tunnel networks
right before resetting the tunnel bridge when the canary flow was
missing. This meant that it would sync all of the tunnels via RPC and
then wipe them out.

The final issue was that after resetting the tunnel bridge in the
main loop, the tunnel_sync variable was not set to True, so the
tunnels would never be resynchronized.

This patch addresses the three issues in the following ways:
1. Set the failure mode on the bridge before the canary flow is
installed.
2. Run the OVS restart logic before the tunnel synchronization.
3. If the restart logic is triggered, set tunnel_sync to True to
trigger synchronization.

Closes-Bug: #1292105
Change-Id: I6381e3fee49910127c420dd2e3205c64cdb9e185
'}]
commit_message:
OVS agent: Correct bridge setup ordering

This patch fixes three issues that combined to break tunnel networks.

The first issue was the the failure mode was being set on the
integration bridge after the canary flow was installed. This
immediately wiped out the canary flow.

The second problem was that the main loop would sync tunnel networks
right before resetting the tunnel bridge when the canary flow was
missing. This meant that it would sync all of the tunnels via RPC and
then wipe them out.

The final issue was that after resetting the tunnel bridge in the
main loop, the tunnel_sync variable was not set to True, so the
tunnels would never be resynchronized.

This patch addresses the three issues in the following ways:
1. Set the failure mode on the bridge before the canary flow is
installed.
2. Run the OVS restart logic before the tunnel synchronization.
3. If the restart logic is triggered, set tunnel_sync to True to
trigger synchronization.

Closes-Bug: #1292105
Change-Id: I6381e3fee49910127c420dd2e3205c64cdb9e185

We now do builds of the IPA CoreOS ramdisk in the post script. (Ref:
openstack-infra/config/tree/modules/openstack_project/files/

commit_message:
Add infra build script to IPA

We now do builds of the IPA CoreOS ramdisk in the post script. (Ref:
openstack-infra/config/tree/modules/openstack_project/files/
jenkins_job_builder/config/ironic-python-agent-jobs.yaml)
We should store the build script for this in the local repo so we can
modify it as needed without needing commits to openstack-infra/config.

Change-Id: I92655c0552179613c23b129d1e2dce2ef1643391

commit_message:
Avoid empty string for length in os-getConsoleOutput

If the caller does not pass in any value for length, we should
not be sending length='' to the os-getConsoleOutput REST API
as Nova v2 API does not handle it properly

Change-Id: I61db6a92418935dd4d0a8fc149d18417bf434b94
Closes-Bug: #1329563

commit_message:
Remove bonds from configuration on node unnassign

- Bonds should be removed from configuration when node
  unnasigned from cluster
- If no admin network group is found, lookup admin interface
  by cidr only on node.nic_interfaces

This bug partially fixed by previous refactoring

Change-Id: Ibafab7d2aa2a3377a6c184a689a2607b4953ee09
Closes-Bug: #1328163

commit_message:
Remove bonds from configuration on node unnassign

- Bonds should be removed from configuration when node
  unnasigned from cluster
- If no admin network group is found, lookup admin interface
  by cidr only on node.nic_interfaces

This bug partially fixed by previous refactoring

Change-Id: Ibafab7d2aa2a3377a6c184a689a2607b4953ee09
Closes-Bug: #1328163

subject: Ensure all nested attributes loaded once
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8787, 'name': 'Dmitry Borodaenko', 'email': 'angdraug@gmail.com', 'username': 'angdraug'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-25 09:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/handlers/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/handlers/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/sqlalchemy/models/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Ensure all nested attributes loaded once

- subqueryload_all for each nested attributes ensures that
  attribute is loaded once
- minor refactoring of get admin_interface logic in
  network manager to use sql relations instead of queries each time
- removed yield_per from eagerload methods
  see: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_9/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.yield_per
- by deafault collection.eager will use joinedload for each provided field

Change-Id: Ifea46654335bf9ea91835880fbf9d6c96b8b63e7
Closes-Bug: #1328240
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure all nested attributes loaded once

- subqueryload_all for each nested attributes ensures that
  attribute is loaded once
- minor refactoring of get admin_interface logic in
  network manager to use sql relations instead of queries each time
- removed yield_per from eagerload methods
  see: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_9/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.yield_per
- by deafault collection.eager will use joinedload for each provided field

Change-Id: Ifea46654335bf9ea91835880fbf9d6c96b8b63e7
Closes-Bug: #1328240

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 15:12:09.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/serializers/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/rpc/receiver.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/handlers/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/db/sqlalchemy/models/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Improve get_node_networks in network manager

get_node_networks method from network manager
causes multiple queries to database on single api request

adding ip_addrs relationship allows to eagerload all required

Closes-Bug: #1328200
'}]
commit_message:
Improve get_node_networks in network manager

get_node_networks method from network manager
causes multiple queries to database on single api request

adding ip_addrs relationship allows to eagerload all required
data
viewonly required to prevent races in several fake tasks

Change-Id: I5f6fe92707b551b20c5140dd339b3e402a774ee7
Closes-Bug: #1328200

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-06-13 20:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_titles.py', 'specs/template.rst'], 'message': 'Consistent heading capitalization in the template

Different headings in the template follow different capitalization rules
(sentence case vs title case). This patch brings all headings to
sentence case, which is the dominant headings capitalization style in

commit_message:
Consistent heading capitalization in the template

Different headings in the template follow different capitalization rules
(sentence case vs title case). This patch brings all headings to
sentence case, which is the dominant headings capitalization style in
OpenStack documentation.

Change-Id: I939a296aaca8a68ae9afdff60bb54f59965d22a6

Remove the StorageAPI class

The StorageAPI class's core functionality has been replaced with a small
decorator which handles TX's, removing the original need for the
StorageAPI class

This patch alters service.py in the following ways:

1  Implements an EngineEndpoints class which represents the engine
   RPC entrypoints
2  Changes EngineListener inherited class to match oslo.messaging
3 .Changes EngineService inherited class to match oslo.messaging
4. Create a Dispatch class to link the engine handlers with endpoints.
5. Implements an EngineDispatcher class which inherits RPCDispatcher

It is not possible to separate notifications from service.py because
of duplicate option errors or unregistered option errors related to
running both oslo.messaging and oslo-incubator which cannot be fixed
since they operate in the same process address space (heat-engine).

Change-Id: I8b43e5089526e81c6344c621382ae8b037cb3a78
blueprint: oslo-messaging
'}]
commit_message:
Port notifications and service to oslo.messaging

This patch alters service.py in the following ways:

1  Implements an EngineEndpoints class which represents the engine
   RPC entrypoints
2  Changes EngineListener inherited class to match oslo.messaging
3 .Changes EngineService inherited class to match oslo.messaging
4. Create a Dispatch class to link the engine handlers with endpoints.
5. Implements an EngineDispatcher class which inherits RPCDispatcher

It is not possible to separate notifications from service.py because
of duplicate option errors or unregistered option errors related to
running both oslo.messaging and oslo-incubator which cannot be fixed
since they operate in the same process address space (heat-engine).

Change-Id: I8b43e5089526e81c6344c621382ae8b037cb3a78
blueprint: oslo-messaging

Creates a self._client in the EngineClient class for usage as the

commit_message:
Add rpc_init that initializes oslo.messaging

Add an rpc_init module which obtains clients and servers from the
RPC layer.  To meet review requirements, some of openstack.common.rpc
had to be modified to handle duplicate and unregistered option
incompatibilites between oslo.messaging and oslo-incubator/rpc

Backwards compatibility is ensured for Havana/Grizzly config files
via the TRANSPORT_ALIASES feature.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ic885c0daac5dec03fd34d5aabcfeb2e470f14486

commit_message:
Always check keystone using http

The check to $service_port must be done using http. It's
$KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PORT that may use either the http or https protocol.

partial blueprint devstack-https
Change-Id: I8ae081e9710c54396b765210336a7de331947086

commit_message:
Removed 'message' keyword when raising Error

The exception handler for listing nova images (now glance images)
was raising an unexpected argument exception because Error() was
getting called with a 'message' keyword. Removed the keyword in
line with elsewhere.

Change-Id: If928aec0bb807495a00b8447a69c4e3dea43fb3b
Closes-Bug: 1315456

commit_message:
Add explicit libkrb5-dev dependency for keystone

Our Trusty test nodes do not include libkrb5-dev by default, and it is
needed to install some of the python libraries keystone uses (kerberos,
brought in by requests-kerberos).

Partial bug: #1334326

Change-Id: I1fdaa46c4590e69da82365dee578c1aa0ec95e80

The set_admin_password operation is not a lifecycle operation like
building or deleting an instance, or resize for that matter, so replace
usage of _set_instance_error_state which does a host stats update with
_set_instance_obj_error_state which just sets the instance state to
error and handles any InstanceNotFound exception (in case we still want

Change-Id: Ie1d1075095ed5d318d0d7a638526bc5cd40d4583
'}]
commit_message:
Use _set_instance_obj_error_state in compute manager set_admin_password

The set_admin_password operation is not a lifecycle operation like
building or deleting an instance, or resize for that matter, so replace
usage of _set_instance_error_state which does a host stats update with
_set_instance_obj_error_state which just sets the instance state to
error and handles any InstanceNotFound exception (in case we still want
to be a little paranoid).

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: Ie1d1075095ed5d318d0d7a638526bc5cd40d4583

commit_message:
Improve help strings

Several changes to make help strings consistent:
* End options with "."
* Add missing space between lines
* Capitalize first word of help strings
* Improve wording of text
* Make strings consistent.
* Use "VPN service"

Closes-Bug: #1321871

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-13 20:30:40.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_actions.py', 'tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_server_actions.py'], 'message': 'Handle backup not found in test_create_backup

The "oldest" backup in the test_create_backup test is supposed
to be deleted automatically via rotation but the cleanup routine
does not catch the NotFound exception when the delete function
doesn't find the backup image. This commit handles the NotFound
and also logs a warning if the image was actually deleted in
case of a race condition.

Change-Id: Ieae2edf0ae4318aef74aedef18480df165fd4753
Closes-Bug: #1291683
'}]
commit_message:
Handle backup not found in test_create_backup

The "oldest" backup in the test_create_backup test is supposed
to be deleted automatically via rotation but the cleanup routine
does not catch the NotFound exception when the delete function
doesn't find the backup image. This commit handles the NotFound
and also logs a warning if the image was actually deleted in
case of a race condition.

Change-Id: Ieae2edf0ae4318aef74aedef18480df165fd4753
Closes-Bug: #1291683

commit_message:
I/O (PCIe) based NUMA scheduling

    This feature will add support for intelligent NUMA node placement for
    guests that have been assigned a hosts PCI device, avoiding unnecessary
    memory transactions.

    Implements: blueprint input-output-based-numa-scheduling

Change-Id: I0bb5ac4ccf4a2defd9fd2a186f0a13dc3717d83b

commit_message:
Add CLI suppport for troubleshooting failed stack

Add the command action-continue in the CLI.  The call only works on failed stack-create.
This allows the user to correct a problem in the environment and continue the
the stack deployment.  This patch covers the CLI.  Patches for the API and Heat
engine are submitted separately.

Change-Id: Ia1d5330721b399276427ebaa5f099c34d36765bc
Partially-implements: blueprint troubleshooting-low-level-control

This code in the engine responds to the action-continue command and
operates on a failed stack-create.  The failed resources are deleted and
reset to the init state, then the stack-create is continued normally.
This allows the user to debug and fix the environmental problem that
caused the failure.  Currently continuing a failed stack-update is
deferred until update failure recovery is implemented.
This patch covers the engine;  two other patches cover the API and CLI.

Partially-implements: blueprint troubleshooting-low-level-control

commit_message:
Add Heat engine support for troubleshooting failed stack

This code in the engine responds to the action-continue command and
operates on a failed stack-create.  The failed resources are deleted and
reset to the init state, then the stack-create is continued normally.
This allows the user to debug and fix the environmental problem that
caused the failure.  Currently continuing a failed stack-update is
deferred until update failure recovery is implemented.
This patch covers the engine;  two other patches cover the API and CLI.

Change-Id: I66903cdc2e31d73c3f6fa2fe1588c995837cd6ca
Partially-implements: blueprint troubleshooting-low-level-control

commit_message:
Add API suppport for troubleshooting failed stack

Add the command action-continue in the API.  The call only works on failed stack-create.
This allows the user to correct a problem in the environment and continue
the stack deployment.  This patch covers the API.  Patches for the CLI and Heat
engine are submitted separately.

Change-Id: I4683a65315d9274b8fbeba3c103062c58c789328
Partially-implements: blueprint troubleshooting-low-level-control

subject: Fix swift-recon --auditor bug
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1005, 'name': "Eamonn O'Toole", 'email': 'eamonn.otoole@hp.com', 'username': 'eamonn-otoole'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-25 14:08:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/recon.py'], 'message': "Fix swift-recon --auditor bug

I introduced a bug in swift-recon --auditor, which Christian
Schwede uncovered.  Christian proposed a fix which replaces the
generator nested_get_value with a recursive function which
returns just one instance of a key.  Christian's fix will break
the parallel object auditor patch which uses the generator to
return all instances of a particular key in a nested dictionary
and then sums those values.

This alternative fix sums over all values returned by
nested_get_value, as is done in the parallel auditor patch.

Change-Id: I6ac403395ab42d11161d6df266e8fbd5a2af9a64
"}]
commit_message:
Fix swift-recon --auditor bug

I introduced a bug in swift-recon --auditor, which Christian
Schwede uncovered.  Christian proposed a fix which replaces the
generator nested_get_value with a recursive function which
returns just one instance of a key.  Christian's fix will break
the parallel object auditor patch which uses the generator to
return all instances of a particular key in a nested dictionary
and then sums those values.

This alternative fix sums over all values returned by
nested_get_value, as is done in the parallel auditor patch.

Change-Id: I6ac403395ab42d11161d6df266e8fbd5a2af9a64

commit_message:
Minor cleanups in test_volume

Fix incorrect parameter order for mock decorators.  This
just happened to work because they were used in the same way
in test_reserve_volume_success().

Remove incorrect comments.  These seem to mix up 'error' versus
'error_deleting' for expected states -- but the assertEqual args
are sufficiently explanatory by themselves.

Change-Id: I763265b8365d3b2fcece94b14639a1bed7b6a848

commit_message:
Build retry loop for screen sessions

There is a timing window where we might lose the commands being
stuffed into screen because bash is spawning. In those cases, loop
around and try building screen sessions again.

Change-Id: I49247de06bbd59424cb10fb9a8db145907be5138
Related-Bug: #1331274

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7882, 'name': 'Yuiko Takada Mori', 'email': 'yuiko-mori@nec.com', 'username': 'YuikoTakada'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-25 16:22:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/chassis.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': 'Remove from_chassis/from_nodes from the API doc

The flags from_chassis/from_nodes are internal flags and are used
to indicate whether the requests coming to the controller are
coming from the top-level resource and so prevent some actions like
creating/deleting/updating a resource to happen, this flags were being
passed to the class constructor and were appearing in the auto-generated
API documentation as a misleading parameter that could be passed as part
of the resource URI.

This patch is removing those flags from the class constructors.

Closes-Bug: #1329389
Change-Id: I6b6ba2ab303fb485350f52569539ac405ec5ade3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove from_chassis/from_nodes from the API doc

The flags from_chassis/from_nodes are internal flags and are used
to indicate whether the requests coming to the controller are
coming from the top-level resource and so prevent some actions like
creating/deleting/updating a resource to happen, this flags were being
passed to the class constructor and were appearing in the auto-generated
API documentation as a misleading parameter that could be passed as part
of the resource URI.

This patch is removing those flags from the class constructors.

Closes-Bug: #1329389
Change-Id: I6b6ba2ab303fb485350f52569539ac405ec5ade3

may slow down the other guest instances. This patch limits bandwidth for

Change-Id: I32347d2e28842725207a1b3afac7fe137a3fd3b4

commit_message:
I/O rate limit for volume copy with dd

Currently, volume copy operations consumes disk I/O bandwidth heavily and
may slow down the other guest instances. This patch limits bandwidth for
volume copy to mitigate interference to other instance performance.

In this implementation, 'dd' is put in a blkio cgroup for throttling,
when CONF.volume_copy_bps_limit is set to non-zero.

Change-Id: I32347d2e28842725207a1b3afac7fe137a3fd3b4
Signed-off-by: Tomoki Sekiyama <tomoki.sekiyama@hds.com>
Implements: blueprint limit-volume-copy-bandwidth

commit_message:
Allow retry on ping probe fail

Ping retry was not run when ping command had finished with error code != 0.
It is fixed now. Number of packets to be received is decreased to 1.

Closes-Bug: #1322102
Change-Id: I5fe84387e8e23fb918da2d4cc0bb3e9cf0fe02f8

commit_message:
Increase the count of ping probes

It's allowed now to get at least 3 answers for no more than 10 requests.
Interval between connectivity checks is increaced (30 -> 60 sec).

Closes-Bug: #1322102
Change-Id: Iec2b68d2e8f93cf57e1db93953c79d20d3fb86c7
Original Change-Id: I0b227e3426c3d8b453986e6545829a11e125ce0b

Differencing VHDX images can be resized, unlike differencing

This feature is required for resizing existing instances which

commit_message:
Add differencing vhdx resize support in Hyper-V Driver

Differencing VHDX images can be resized, unlike differencing
VHD images. Even so, the Nova Hyper-V driver currently does
not support this.

This feature is required for resizing existing instances which
use CoW VHDX images and also in order to resize the root disk
image when spawning a new instance.

Change-Id: Iba8ea427776ed1fc90e3b326662a1ddf07898cd1

commit_message:
Add ChainingRegExpFilter for prefix utilities

This patch adds ChainingRegExpFilter to filter commands prefixed to other
commands, such as 'nice' and 'ionice'. This filter only checks specified
number of arguments, and remaining arguments are filtered by the other
existing filters.

Change-Id: Ica014c472c7e1376f107a039452b215e5c2c4ee5
Implements: blueprint chaining-regexp-filter
Signed-off-by: Tomoki Sekiyama <tomoki.sekiyama@hds.com>

The libvirt driver currently uses the legacy libvirt APIs

commit_message:
Speedup listing of domains in libvirt driver

The libvirt driver currently uses the legacy libvirt APIs
for getting lists of domains. These are inefficient and
prone to race conditions, so have been replaced by much
better designed APIs.

This review implements blueprint python-request and replaces the old
http client implementation in favor of a new one based on
python-requests.

Major changes:

* raw_request and json_request removed since everything is now being
  handled by the same method "_request"
* New methods that match HTTP's methods were added:
    - get
    - put
    - post
    - head
    - patch
    - delete
* Content-Type is now being "inferred" based on the data being sent:
    - if it is file-like object it chunks the request
    - if it is a python type not instance of basestring then it'll try
      to serialize it to json
    - Every other case will keep the incoming content-type and will send
      the data as is.
* Glanceclient's HTTPSConnection implementation will be used if
  no-compression flag is set to True.

To Reviewers:
    - There were some rebase conflicts so, double check the
      common/http.py module

Change-Id: Ic22ddd0fc4ef5cea4bcf1df1441d86ebb788f091
'}]
commit_message:
Replace old httpclient with requests

This review implements blueprint python-request and replaces the old
http client implementation in favor of a new one based on
python-requests.

Major changes:

* raw_request and json_request removed since everything is now being
  handled by the same method "_request"
* New methods that match HTTP's methods were added:
    - get
    - put
    - post
    - head
    - patch
    - delete
* Content-Type is now being "inferred" based on the data being sent:
    - if it is file-like object it chunks the request
    - if it is a python type not instance of basestring then it'll try
      to serialize it to json
    - Every other case will keep the incoming content-type and will send
      the data as is.
* Glanceclient's HTTPSConnection implementation will be used if
  no-compression flag is set to True.

To Reviewers:
    - There were some rebase conflicts so, double check the
      common/http.py module

Change-Id: Ic22ddd0fc4ef5cea4bcf1df1441d86ebb788f091

commit_message:
Sync post-nova_config notification for generic services

"Exec['post-nova_config'] ~> Service<| title == $nova_title |>"
in upstream ensures generic services would be restarted
only after all configuration changes made.
We should use it as well.

Closes-bug: #1320923

Change-Id: I72fe425f11a28b111f6d9a5d858e3d398ad34116
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Delete undeclared variable in guest-agent API class

The commit c7d93e7ce74c20a9c59ee0d2d542ed5b54d9c39c (not linked to
a gerrit review) introduced a local variable "timeout", used in a
 method of the API class

The review I9ad1b441eca855a4304454014ae746ec51bef8f3 deleted the
declaration of this variable but did not remove where it was used
in the class.

This patch removes the unused variable.

Closes-Bug: #1332333
Change-Id: Ie7aa66ceeca4efe63d91d60bcedb760ec181d443

commit_message:
Synced jsonutils from oslo-incubator

The sync includes change that drastically enhances performance on Python
2.6 with fresh simplejson library installed.

Included commits:
* jsonutils.py:
  - 1b901885: Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()
  - cd909d83: jsonutils.load() accepts file pointer, not string
  - d14f56f0: On Python <= 2.6, use simplejson if available

This change also introduces new incubator module 'strutils' that is used
by jsonutils now.

Change-Id: Ief94101488214ddf93c3547a9c50134826b9b165
Closes-Bug: 1314129
