commit_message:
NSX sync cache: add a flag to skip item deletion

This new flag will prevent updates on single resources, which
can happen asynchronously to the main synchronization thread,
from processing the 'changed' flag for items in the cache and
delete items not present anymore in NSX.

This will avoid failures seen in CI runs where the sync
thread failed because of a KeyError because some items where
concurrently removed from the NSX cache.

Change-Id: I6a11b8dabb1e9481dc807b5fbba17c9027dad5f2
Closes-Bug: #1329650

commit_message:
NSX: return 400 if dscp set for trusted queue

If qos_marking is set to True, the code currently silently
drops the dscp setting and continues.

It is preferrable instead to notify the user of the invalid
setting returning a 400 error.

Change-Id: I7db1867712bd20f2030c56a42baac20e6ae76d0d
Closes-Bug: 1332062

commit_message:
Set firewall_rules only after appending all rules

The firewall_rules attribute was being re-set per each firewall rule.
Instead if should only be set once when all firewall rules are appended
to _firewall_rules.

A minor PEP E128 (continuation line under-lined) is also being fixed
here.

Change-Id: I9db6d3dc0ad11a3194513d80f15151c29aa019cd
Closes-Bug: 1328625

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-24 18:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Don't count 412 or 416 as errors in stats

The backend HTTP servers emit StatsD metrics of the form
<server>.<method>.timing and <server>.<method>.errors.timing
(e.g. object-server.GET.timing). Whether something counts as an error
or not is based on the response's HTTP status code.

Prior to this commit, "success" was 2xx, 3xx, or 404, while everything
else was considered "error". This adds 412 and 416 to the "success"
set. Like 404, these status codes indicate that we got the request and
processed it without error, but the response was "no". They shouldn't
be in the same category as statuses like 507 that indicate something
stopped the request from being processed.

Change-Id: I5582a51cf6f64aa22c890da01aaaa077f3a54202
'}]
commit_message:
Don't count 412 or 416 as errors in stats

The backend HTTP servers emit StatsD metrics of the form
<server>.<method>.timing and <server>.<method>.errors.timing
(e.g. object-server.GET.timing). Whether something counts as an error
or not is based on the response's HTTP status code.

Prior to this commit, "success" was 2xx, 3xx, or 404, while everything
else was considered "error". This adds 412 and 416 to the "success"
set. Like 404, these status codes indicate that we got the request and
processed it without error, but the response was "no". They shouldn't
be in the same category as statuses like 507 that indicate something
stopped the request from being processed.

Change-Id: I5582a51cf6f64aa22c890da01aaaa077f3a54202

commit_message:
Remove traces of now unused host capabilities from scheduler

This is take two of this patch. This time after preparing Baremetal
and Ironic code to work with the HostManager changes introduced in
this patch.

Host capabilities updates are no longer used by the scheduler. All host
state is instead fetched from the DB. Some left over fields are still
kept by the host manager but contain no data. This change remove the
last traces of host capabilities from the scheduler.

Baremetal/Ironic host managers used to rely on capabilities info to
decide which host state class to use, VM or baremetal. This has been
broken since host capabilities reporting were removed. This change
works in tandem with prior updates to Baremetal/Ironic node detection
logic to fix this problem.

Important: This must not be approved until the Ironic patch in
https://review.openstack.org/97447 has first landed!

Change-Id: Id5f88c0aa1df9152ddb62904b0544801a8bcfd2a
Closes-Bug: #1260265

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-18 11:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/baremetal_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_baremetal_host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix BaremetalHostManager node detection logic

This is the second patch to prepare baremetal for the removal of
capabilities in Nova HostManager.

BaremetalHostManager used to rely on capabilities info to decide which
host state class to use, VM or baremetal. This has been broken since
host capabilities reporting were removed in Nova, resulting in Nova
HostState class always being used.

This patch fixes the detection logic in BaremetalHostManager to
correctly choose BaremetalHostState class for use with baremetal nodes.
Tests are added to verify that the correct class is used for both vm
and baremetal nodes.

In reality, the new detection logic will not start to deliver the
correct HostState class until the Nova HostManager change that follows
has landed.

Change-Id: I0c2e6d985fb29f35b823cdf9a83fead2fa45082a
Partial-Bug: #1260265
'}]
commit_message:
Fix BaremetalHostManager node detection logic

This is the second patch to prepare baremetal for the removal of
capabilities in Nova HostManager.

BaremetalHostManager used to rely on capabilities info to decide which
host state class to use, VM or baremetal. This has been broken since
host capabilities reporting were removed in Nova, resulting in Nova
HostState class always being used.

This patch fixes the detection logic in BaremetalHostManager to
correctly choose BaremetalHostState class for use with baremetal nodes.
Tests are added to verify that the correct class is used for both vm
and baremetal nodes.

In reality, the new detection logic will not start to deliver the
correct HostState class until the Nova HostManager change that follows
has landed.

Change-Id: I0c2e6d985fb29f35b823cdf9a83fead2fa45082a
Partial-Bug: #1260265

This change declares a fallback of 0 for exceptions without a more
explicit status code.  This was the behaviour prior to Change-Id

commit_message:
Ensure .status_code is defined for all NeutronClientExceptions

nova contains plenty of code like:
  except neutron_client_exc.NeutronClientException as e:
      if e.status_code == 409:
          ...

This change declares a fallback of 0 for exceptions without a more
explicit status code.  This was the behaviour prior to Change-Id
I99b9560b3afaf5884fd00353323267da450338fa

Change-Id: Ib736205066fd5cd9738fd3fb3b64f6590803cf39

commit_message:
Avoid recreate the VENV in setup-clienttools if it exists

This change prevent the setup-clienttools script from recreating
the VENV if one exists already (for example, if the script gets
re-runned).

Change-Id: I15322085f332fa493ad436b94b3e699eb9a2c9ac

commit_message:
Support userspace vhost in ovs vif bindings

Openvswitch based virtual switches that use Intel(R) DPDK offer userspace
vhost mechanism to connect VM‚Äôs to the switch.
To support this mechanism {get_config, plug,unplug}_ovs_usvhost
functons are added. And a config parameter ovs_use_usvhost.

Change-Id: I9ee9247d6c4379a7f2bdfea6ec442860d201dc71
Implements: bp/libvirt-ovs-use-usvhost

commit_message:
*WIP* Use Consistent Resource Names Across Rally

This patch is super-wip -probably doesn't work at all and the unit tests
have not been updated. Have put it up on gerrit just to prevent multiple
people working on the same thing, and maybe to get some feedback.

Idea is to have a single function in rally.utils that generates the name
of all resources.

Change-Id: Id4c3393b91732b68e9e640e1722b4b51d96cc2c8
blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/rally/+spec/consistent-resource-naming

commit_message:
libvirt: add '_' prefix to all get_guest_*_config methods

The get_guest_*_config methods are all internal helpers so should
have a '_' prefix to indicate they are not part of public virt
driver API.

Related-bug: #1333219

subject: Move the error check for "brctl addif"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-25 10:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_linux_net.py'], 'message': 'Move the error check for "brctl addif"

The git commit 873aad92944f8840e772d65eda4b3320d65a9ce7[1] has moved
"brctl addif" command, but the commit did not move its error check.

Now the error check sees the result of "ip addr show dev <interface>
scope global" command wrongly, and the command outputs "Dump was
interrupted and may be inconsistent" sometimes because of a kernel change.
As the result, gate failures happen sometimes.

This patch moves the error check to right place.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/873aad92944f8840e772d65eda4b3320d

Change-Id: I92ee96e3aa34f7cd154a8ce4b33852b96cabe8c9
Closes-Bug: #1334142
'}]
commit_message:
Move the error check for "brctl addif"

The git commit 873aad92944f8840e772d65eda4b3320d65a9ce7[1] has moved
"brctl addif" command, but the commit did not move its error check.

Now the error check sees the result of "ip addr show dev <interface>
scope global" command wrongly, and the command outputs "Dump was
interrupted and may be inconsistent" sometimes because of a kernel change.
As the result, gate failures happen sometimes.

This patch moves the error check to right place.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/873aad92944f8840e772d65eda4b3320d

Change-Id: I92ee96e3aa34f7cd154a8ce4b33852b96cabe8c9
Closes-Bug: #1334142

is "Boot from image (creates new volume)"

commit_message:
ovs agent: re-sync tunnels if openvswitch restarts

When openvswitch restarts and ovs agent not, br-tun lost all ports/flows
because of setup_tunnel_br(), setting tunnel_sync = True could fix the
problem if l2-pop is not used. The fix for using l2-pop will in another
commit.

Change-Id: I845ea9b0863f5d641c9c8fac0f371f548d1c0da6
Partial-bug: #1332450

commit_message:
Add using share-server backend details in Generic driver

Method setup_network returns server data:
 - instance_id
 - ip
 - authentication data
 (username, password, private key path)

Removed storing server info in memory.
Renamed method get_service_instance to set_up_service_instance.

Removed discover_service_instance method.
Added method ensure_service_instance to check if
instance is running.

Partially-Implements bp implement-backend-details-in-drivers

Change-Id: I857f47510db8d575b3003491b3d3d49a54cf15f5

commit_message:
Move nova.utils.cpu_count() to processutils module

This moves and renames nova.utils.cpu_count() utility method from nova
to oslo.  Added in commit 75c96a48fc7e5dfb59d8258142b01422f81b0253, this
is used to set the default number of nova api/conductor workers if not
explicitly specified in nova.conf.

I'm moving this to oslo so that we can use the same default worker logic
in other projects, i.e. cinder, trove, glance and taskflow.

Closes-Bug: #1333370

Change-Id: I81748a15f8da85e287afdb5ec9de6369f8919ab0

properly information presentation. Interfaces change has similar
structure to disc change: {node_id=2, name="interfaces"}.

commit_message:
Fix reconnect race condition with RabbitMQ cluster

Retry declaring Queue if it fail to workaround the race condition
that may happen when both Neutron and RabbitMQ cluster are trying
to create and delete (Respectively) Queues and Exchanges that have
auto-delete flag set.

Change-Id: I90febd7c8358b7cccf852c272810e2fad3d91dcd
Closes-Bug: #1318721

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-06-17 11:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/bin/reset-db'], 'message': "Don't restart mysql during reset-db

A part of reset-db script is cleaning up old files and
restarting DB, this is not ideal in cluster environment
where simple restart is not sufficient - cluster has to
be bootstrapped at first.

Proper mysql startup is handled by a separate orc script.

Cleaning mysql files is not needed too because both percona
and mariadb installations do not pre-create these files.
File ownership is set properly for mysql/mariadb too.

Change-Id: Ida81b53a33bdf0240ccd1432e6ee5da1e7fb0133
"}]
commit_message:
Don't restart mysql during reset-db

A part of reset-db script is cleaning up old files and
restarting DB, this is not ideal in cluster environment
where simple restart is not sufficient - cluster has to
be bootstrapped at first.

Proper mysql startup is handled by a separate orc script.

Cleaning mysql files is not needed too because both percona
and mariadb installations do not pre-create these files.
File ownership is set properly for mysql/mariadb too.

Change-Id: Ida81b53a33bdf0240ccd1432e6ee5da1e7fb0133

The current implementation of the decorator allow_all_content_types was
slightly confusing, since while iterating through the mimetypes it would

commit_message:
Refactor allow_all_content_types for readability

The current implementation of the decorator allow_all_content_types was
slightly confusing, since while iterating through the mimetypes it would
call setdefault each time for the same object. So I separated that call
from the iteration that sets the default values to make it clear. Also,
the iteration was turned into a generator for a more pythonic approach
and performance.

Change-Id: I2e57cb38a4e1bca21af6272a2f4d72b7ef032845

commit_message:
Fixed passing share_server to teardown_network

Pass share_server backend_details to teardown network.
Removed calling db method share_server_get which raises
exception if share server does not exists with calling
method _get_share_server in delete_share.

Partially-implements bp implement-backend-details-in-drivers
Related-Bug #1332080

Change-Id: Id34c1b299f28d5e6050c481dce01b6f70d1be995

In Juno, the ability to make public images will be admin-only by

commit_message:
Change docs to use non-public images by default

In Juno, the ability to make public images will be admin-only by
default. This patch changes areas of the documentation that
aren't explicitly known to be working with admin-level credentials
to use is-public=False in their image uploads. This encourages good
security practice, and will hopefully avoid bug reports from users
who don't have access trying to make public images.

Change-Id: I8ca05c7507e1e63d39c927388f95fc584dfbe34d
Partial-Bug: 1328302

commit_message:

subject: Allow specifying SSH private key to _testenv
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9453, 'name': 'James Polley', 'email': 'jp@jamezpolley.com', 'username': 'tchaypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-20 04:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_testenv.sh'], 'message': "Allow specifying SSH private key to _testenv

devtest_testenv.sh currently hardcodes a path for the SSH private
key, which means that CI will always create nodes with pm_password
set to null because ssh-key is set to null because the file doesn't
exist. Add a -s argument to allow specifying the private key path.

Change-Id: Icd9220e3d660d097bad6bc33090b9ef1758c5945
"}]
commit_message:
Allow specifying SSH private key to _testenv

devtest_testenv.sh currently hardcodes a path for the SSH private
key, which means that CI will always create nodes with pm_password
set to null because ssh-key is set to null because the file doesn't
exist. Add a -s argument to allow specifying the private key path.

Change-Id: Icd9220e3d660d097bad6bc33090b9ef1758c5945

commit_message:
Fix nginx start.sh script, to set right permissions for dump directory

Run `chmod -R 755 /var/www/nailgun/*`, to
set permissions for /var/www/nailgun/dump
which is symlink to /dump. We have to do it,
because chmod -R doesn't follow symlinks.

Change-Id: I43f9b9164d8f0f4d8ddb7d06cc2549145bd135bb
Closes-bug: #1333631

commit_message:
Fix structure of unit tests in oslo.messaging (part 1)

Even in case of libraries and when they are not big like nova.
It is better to use next rules:

1) structure of tests directory is the same as a root of project
Tests directory will be well organized, and it will be simple to find
where to write tests

2) names for end modules should be test_<name_of_testing_module>.py

Change-Id: Ie13d1b709e863f6a9babaaa2bf1e042ef9251671

commit_message:
Prevent "No handlers could be found..." logging

To prevent this message from being logged during unit tests runs
or heat-manage calls, the following changes have been made:
* Make the instance_users deprecation warning use "warnings" and
  move to engine init
* patch out warnings for engine tests
* do not log barbican or marconi if importing their clients fails

Change-Id: Icc4be26bf334a6ce31ad3b8fe9fd244cd9e37be2
Closes-Bug: #1333408

This shows that our templates are not relying on this functionality any more.

commit_message:
PoC: Remove MERGABLE_TYPES from merge.py

This shows that our templates are not relying on this functionality any more.
Running `make -B all` before this commit and diff the results with `make -B all`
with it produces identical templates.

This makes me inclined to just go ahead and kill it. Any reason we should keep
it for backwards compatibility sake? Is anyone else actually using this?

Change-Id: I0c5edaea18a772432ffed7b959901aeeb9b38d56

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 flavor_manage API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

commit_message:
MuranoPL testing mini-framework

Introduces simple helper layer for testing MuranoPL code.
It provides customized class loader for sample test YAML classes and
fluent syntax to build Object Model and invoke various methods on it.

Also contains basic test that tests both the framework and the very basics of
MuranoPL execution

Change-Id: I3c1dfea4ea29824cb3149b122ce9cf95365d32bc
Implements: blueprint muranopl-testing-framework

commit_message:
Support hot-plug USB device

Users have requirements of using USB device, the detailed information can refer
to BP https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/usb-passthrough.
There maybe some VMs which need to use USB device dynamically, so I think it is
necessary to provide function of hot-plug USB device.

blueprint usb-hot-plug

Change-Id: I4044693074e52a65a0c1cc51a07fbf6c4b4a0535

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-18 11:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/baremetal_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_baremetal_host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Add missing stats info to BaremetalNodeState

This is the first of two patches to prepare baremetal for the removal
of capabilities in Nova HostManager.

BaremetalHostManager used to rely on capabilities info to decide which
host state class to use, VM or baremetal. This has been broken since
host capabilities reporting were removed in Nova, resulting in Nova
HostState class always being used.

BaremetalNodeState lacks stats info needed by some filters during
scheduling. This may result in failures like ComputeCapabilitiesFilter
not returning any hosts. This must be fixed before BaremetalNodeState
can be used again.

Change-Id: I63d992371640b2fd33d35eae72201fd41944f8a4
Partial-Bug: #1260265
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing stats info to BaremetalNodeState

This is the first of two patches to prepare baremetal for the removal
of capabilities in Nova HostManager.

BaremetalHostManager used to rely on capabilities info to decide which
host state class to use, VM or baremetal. This has been broken since
host capabilities reporting were removed in Nova, resulting in Nova
HostState class always being used.

BaremetalNodeState lacks stats info needed by some filters during
scheduling. This may result in failures like ComputeCapabilitiesFilter
not returning any hosts. This must be fixed before BaremetalNodeState
can be used again.

Change-Id: I63d992371640b2fd33d35eae72201fd41944f8a4
Partial-Bug: #1260265

subject: libvirt: Separate classes for each hypervisor type
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-30 20:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/libvirt-separate-virt-types-to-classes.rst'], 'message': "libvirt: Separate classes for each hypervisor type

Currently libvirt driver supports several hypervisor types.
However, variuos hypervisor type specific changes may harm
the functionality of other types.
It also seems to be more practical to implement hypervisor
specific changes in it's own class.

Would like to separate each hypervisor type functionality to it's
own class and refactor the base class to support inheritance.

Implements blueprint libvirt-separate-virt-types-to-classes
Change-Id: I908b4edc27e2888448dbe946aabcec739c54b851
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Separate classes for each hypervisor type

Currently libvirt driver supports several hypervisor types.
However, variuos hypervisor type specific changes may harm
the functionality of other types.
It also seems to be more practical to implement hypervisor
specific changes in it's own class.

Would like to separate each hypervisor type functionality to it's
own class and refactor the base class to support inheritance.

Implements blueprint libvirt-separate-virt-types-to-classes
Change-Id: I908b4edc27e2888448dbe946aabcec739c54b851

subject: Propose: add a data transfer plug-in
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2861, 'name': 'Vincent Hou', 'email': 'shou@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'houshengbo'}, {'_account_id': 8430, 'name': 'Christopher Lefelhocz', 'email': 'christopher.lefelhoc@rackspace.com', 'username': 'leif'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-22 14:57:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/data-transfer-plugin.rst'], 'message': 'Propose: add a data transfer plug-in

There are two use cases for data transfer in general:
1. The machines are located in one network, e.g. one domain, one cluster,
etc. The characteristic is the machines can access each other directly via
the IP addresses(VPN is beyond consideration).
2. The machines are located in different networks, e.g. two data centers,
two firewalls, etc. The characteristic is the machines can not access each
other directly via the IP addresses(VPN is beyond consideration).

With this plug-in, data can be transferred between two machines,
no matter they are in the same network or in different networks.

Related blueprint: data-transfer-service-plugin

Change-Id: Ic1396215c8b909f16a8ce8aa51ffc5f9b1c75108
'}]
commit_message:
Propose: add a data transfer plug-in

There are two use cases for data transfer in general:
1. The machines are located in one network, e.g. one domain, one cluster,
etc. The characteristic is the machines can access each other directly via
the IP addresses(VPN is beyond consideration).
2. The machines are located in different networks, e.g. two data centers,
two firewalls, etc. The characteristic is the machines can not access each
other directly via the IP addresses(VPN is beyond consideration).

With this plug-in, data can be transferred between two machines,
no matter they are in the same network or in different networks.

Related blueprint: data-transfer-service-plugin

Change-Id: Ic1396215c8b909f16a8ce8aa51ffc5f9b1c75108

commit_message:
Restrict live migration when consoles are open

Users shouldn't be affected due to live migration especially when
they are using consoles. If users are connected to the console then instance
migration shouldn't be allowed, instead it should return 409 error to the
administrator.

Change-Id: I270cd8ee95248397dcd018c21437c1417165e48d

commit_message:
Add dynamic adjust disk qos support

Now we has supported setting the disk's QOS when creating instance or attaching
volume to instance. There is no way to adjust QOS without taking some action
which may makes the instance's status change or volume's status change.

blueprint dynamic-adjust-disk-qos

Change-Id: I9942639d5514b201a4f87a4ab61ead9b4d7d17f2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-11 21:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/template.rst'], 'message': 'Tell people to reference git commits over reviews

Reviews that are currently open can often get abandoned and/or split
into multiple reviews. Referencing a changing target like a review makes
it easy for a spec to become out of date.

Added a note in the work items section that expresses a preference to
instead reference git commits, as opposed to reviews in gerrit.

Change-Id: Ida5476481a69db0014831b8657d2fb1ce2a3b046
'}]
commit_message:
Tell people to reference git commits over reviews

Reviews that are currently open can often get abandoned and/or split
into multiple reviews. Referencing a changing target like a review makes
it easy for a spec to become out of date.

Added a note in the work items section that expresses a preference to
instead reference git commits, as opposed to reviews in gerrit.

Change-Id: Ida5476481a69db0014831b8657d2fb1ce2a3b046

This blueprint would add support for using Sheepdog as a block-device
backend for libvirt instances. Looking for comments and suggestions.

commit_message:
Blueprint for Specifying Number of Cores Per Socket on Instance

The proposal is to add an image property that specifies cores_per_socket on an
image which would allow you to override the default of one core per socket and
specify the number you want on the instance.

Change-Id: Ib6909bce5e13faf929273ce9ba69461a30fb0eea

commit_message:
Propose: Add server snapshot support

Notes: Please forgive me for my poor language skill. I have not
come up with a better name for this proposal, so just tentatively
call it server snapshot. The server snapshot here means a
snapshot/restore point used to save the status of an VM and used
to restore this VM only, which is different from the nova snapshot.

Related to blueprint driver-specific-snapshot

Change-Id: Ifabe546f60a1e4d93817e217fd1a53d1c0a5768e

commit_message:
nova-specs: Add sharePolicy element for vnc

From libvirt 1.0.6 version onwards share policy feature is supported
to control the way consoles are accessed by the user. We can use this
share policy for domain's VNC console by adding it to libvirt driver
in nova to manage the opening of number of VNC sessions.

Change-Id: I22522c086b9120d0baa4b638f7ebb45a79d0b100

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-24 11:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_patcher.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/patcher.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/utils.py'], 'message': "Do not delete pxe_deploy_{kernel, ramdisk} on tear down

As part of the instance_info work it was agreed that the deploy kernel
and ramdisk IDs should be passed to Node when enrolling it and not be
present on the Flavor anymore so that we can enable Ironic to support
different deploy provisioning methods using the same Flavor. The problem
is that right now Ironic is always removing the pxe_deploy_kernel and
pxe_deploy_ramdisk parameters from the driver_info as part of the tear
down process, but it shouldn't because those parameters should be constant
across multiple deployments to the node.

This patch fixing it by adding a backward compatible layer that would
work for both: The old way, by having the deploy kernel/ramdisk ID in
the flavor. And the new way, passing the deploy kernel/ramdisk as part
of the enrollment process of the node.

Ironic Nova driver will stash it on driver_info when deploying the
node and delete it from driver_info when unprovisioning the node, if
it's not on the Flavor, the Ironic Nova driver does neither of those
(and either it's already on the node's driver_info and things work,
or the node fails on validate)

Implements: blueprint add-node-instance-info
Change-Id: I67e2deffaa55a754a7649f8863f7ac3c033dbf6f
"}]
commit_message:
Do not delete pxe_deploy_{kernel, ramdisk} on tear down

As part of the instance_info work it was agreed that the deploy kernel
and ramdisk IDs should be passed to Node when enrolling it and not be
present on the Flavor anymore so that we can enable Ironic to support
different deploy provisioning methods using the same Flavor. The problem
is that right now Ironic is always removing the pxe_deploy_kernel and
pxe_deploy_ramdisk parameters from the driver_info as part of the tear
down process, but it shouldn't because those parameters should be constant
across multiple deployments to the node.

This patch fixing it by adding a backward compatible layer that would
work for both: The old way, by having the deploy kernel/ramdisk ID in
the flavor. And the new way, passing the deploy kernel/ramdisk as part
of the enrollment process of the node.

If the deploy kernel and ramdisk IDs are present on the flavor, the
Ironic Nova driver will stash it on driver_info when deploying the
node and delete it from driver_info when unprovisioning the node, if
it's not on the Flavor, the Ironic Nova driver does neither of those
(and either it's already on the node's driver_info and things work,
or the node fails on validate)

Implements: blueprint add-node-instance-info
Change-Id: I67e2deffaa55a754a7649f8863f7ac3c033dbf6f

commit_message:
Implement scaling for Spark clusters

This patch adds support for scaling Spark clusters in the Sahara Spark
plugin. The code had been stripped when the Spark plugin was initially
proposed to simplify the review process, now it has been updated and
bugs have been fixed.

Both scaling up and down is supported.

Documentation will be updated in another patch set.

Partial-implements: blueprint spark-plugin

Change-Id: I2bca33edb1bd6649a1e1f333a32ded0f79127477

subject: Implement security groups and firewall filtering methods
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-24 10:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Implement security groups and firewall filtering methods

Implement security groups and firewall filtering related methods in the
Nova Ironic Driver, the methods implemented are:

* refresh_security_group_rules() invoked when security group rules
  are updated

* refresh_security_group_members() invoked when instances are
  added/removed to a security group.

* refresh_provider_fw_rules() invoked when a firewall rule is added or
  removed from the list of rules.

* refresh_instance_security_rules() invoked when an instance gets added
  to or removed from the security group the instance is a member of or if
  the group gains or looses a rule.

* ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance() used to ensure that an instance's
  filtering rules are enabled.

* unfilter_instance() to stop filtering the instance.

Change-Id: Ib464dc6df4b03c952d564fdd4185ffbab59a8bc8
"}]
commit_message:
Implement security groups and firewall filtering methods

Implement security groups and firewall filtering related methods in the
Nova Ironic Driver, the methods implemented are:

* refresh_security_group_rules() invoked when security group rules
  are updated

* refresh_security_group_members() invoked when instances are
  added/removed to a security group.

* refresh_provider_fw_rules() invoked when a firewall rule is added or
  removed from the list of rules.

* refresh_instance_security_rules() invoked when an instance gets added
  to or removed from the security group the instance is a member of or if
  the group gains or looses a rule.

* ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance() used to ensure that an instance's
  filtering rules are enabled.

* unfilter_instance() to stop filtering the instance.

Change-Id: Ib464dc6df4b03c952d564fdd4185ffbab59a8bc8

commit_message:
Drop support for scheduler 2.x rpc interface

In commit 741661a6695ccc56e5f50c4d85954cd3ed9ebda5, a part of
Icehouse, we added support for the 3.x interface.  Now that Juno
development is open, we can drop support for the old 2.x API.

For more information on this change, see:

    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/RpcMajorVersionUpdates

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I7bfad51ae46e999b30e003a5a5c7e341461dba02

commit_message:
Encode should be called only for strings

If not string provided as arg to print_to_output
it should not be encoded, and lets assume that proper unicode handling
will be done in custom print_method

Closes-Bug: #1330485

commit_message:
Add log output of x-openstack-request-id from nova

This patch enables heat to output
'x-openstack-request-id'/'x-compute-request-id'
of nova's responses to the log.

DocImpact: There is a new novaclient configuration
option 'http_log_debug' in heat.common.config

Change-Id: Id085af411c6d4ceddce1a75022c4baec9a8210ce
Closes-bug: #1329612

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-06-25 04:04:06.000000000', 'files': ['elements/heat-cfntools/install.d/05-heat-cfntools'], 'message': 'Refresh heat-cfntools element

- If Fedora, remove the packaged heat-cfntools
- Follow the same setuptools/pbr pattern as os-*-tools
- Specify pip install --pre so that local git built packages will be
  installed if available. It should be possible to always specify
  --pre since public repos do not have snapshot release packages for
  heat-cfntools
- Upgrade the virtualenv installed pip to the latest released pip.
  This is in preperation for the release of pip-1.5.7 which has
  fixes for related-bug: #1301220

Change-Id: I6441f6f78bfb111f7446362d97a2eddc3c51a99f
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh heat-cfntools element

- If Fedora, remove the packaged heat-cfntools
- Follow the same setuptools/pbr pattern as os-*-tools
- Specify pip install --pre so that local git built packages will be
  installed if available. It should be possible to always specify
  --pre since public repos do not have snapshot release packages for
  heat-cfntools
- Upgrade the virtualenv installed pip to the latest released pip.
  This is in preperation for the release of pip-1.5.7 which has
  fixes for related-bug: #1301220

Change-Id: I6441f6f78bfb111f7446362d97a2eddc3c51a99f

commit_message:
Prepare os-*-config for CI

Specify pip install --pre so that local git built packages will be
installed if available. It should be possible to always specify
--pre since public repos do not have snapshot release packages for
these tools

Change-Id: Id2e539ba72ac2ef8d39a3ab694991e9b8bf724d7

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-12 05:59:25.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_parameters.py', 'heat/engine/parameters.py'], 'message': "Add parameter type validation before stack-create

If a number parameter accept a string that can't convert to number,
it will break heat functions and heat cli can't get any stack
information but a ValuerError message.
Add Number and Boolean parameter type validation before stack

Change-Id: I25a41543027f929201a9b053d123d8e2b16e2725
Closes-Bug: #1329152

commit_message:
Add parameter type validation before stack-create

If a number parameter accept a string that can't convert to number,
it will break heat functions and heat cli can't get any stack
information but a ValuerError message.
Add Number and Boolean parameter type validation before stack
create, so we can avoid above situation.

Change-Id: I25a41543027f929201a9b053d123d8e2b16e2725
Closes-Bug: #1329152

control nodes in HA mode.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-25 05:27:22.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/http.py'], 'message': 'Do not set up logging handler in http

A logging handler should not be set up in the http module as this
can cause unintended debug logging of all requests when
python-heatclient is used as a library. This is causing log bloat
in tempest gate runs.

This change removes the logging handler from the http module.
This does not affect the --debug option of the heat cli.

Change-Id: I634dc3bb96f3880df322bd627c9075ebac13add8
Closes-Bug: #1330492
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set up logging handler in http

A logging handler should not be set up in the http module as this
can cause unintended debug logging of all requests when
python-heatclient is used as a library. This is causing log bloat
in tempest gate runs.

This change removes the logging handler from the http module.
This does not affect the --debug option of the heat cli.

Change-Id: I634dc3bb96f3880df322bd627c9075ebac13add8
Closes-Bug: #1330492

subject: Store swift data, db & objects on /mnt filesystem
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@gmail.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 1253, 'name': 'Gerry Drudy', 'email': 'gerry.drudy@hpe.com', 'username': 'gerry-drudy'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 5639, 'name': 'Coleman Corrigan', 'email': 'coleman.corrigan@hp.com', 'username': 'coleman-corrigan'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7471, 'name': 'Richard Su', 'email': 'rwsu@redhat.com', 'username': 'rwsu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-06-04 14:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift-storage/os-config-applier/etc/swift/container-server.conf', 'elements/swift-storage/install.d/76-swift-dirs', 'elements/swift-storage/os-config-applier/etc/swift/object-server.conf', 'elements/swift-storage/os-config-applier/etc/rsyncd.conf', 'elements/swift-storage/os-refresh-config/configure.d/20-swift-storage-selinux', 'elements/swift-storage/os-refresh-config/configure.d/15-swift-storage-location', 'elements/swift-storage/os-config-applier/etc/swift/account-server.conf'], 'message': "Store swift data, db & objects on /mnt filesystem

This commit moves the location of the swift account, container and
object data from the root filesystem (/srv/node) to the /mnt
filesystem. This is done for 2 reasons:
  1. The root filesystem tends to be quite small, swift data can fill
     it quite quickly with nasty consequences (for the OS and swift)
  2. Swift data on the root filesystem does not survive a re-install.
     While swift data on the /mnt filesystems does survive.

This commit creates the /mnt/state/srv/node directory and sets
'devices = /mnt/state/srv/node' in the account, container and object
conf files. It also sets 'path = /mnt/state/srv/node/' in
/etc/rsyncd.conf.

Change-Id: I39f70ba9cf4a8c4c068c95667608afafe700f301
"}]
commit_message:
Store swift data, db & objects on /mnt filesystem

This commit moves the location of the swift account, container and
object data from the root filesystem (/srv/node) to the /mnt
filesystem. This is done for 2 reasons:
  1. The root filesystem tends to be quite small, swift data can fill
     it quite quickly with nasty consequences (for the OS and swift)
  2. Swift data on the root filesystem does not survive a re-install.
     While swift data on the /mnt filesystems does survive.

This commit creates the /mnt/state/srv/node directory and sets
'devices = /mnt/state/srv/node' in the account, container and object
conf files. It also sets 'path = /mnt/state/srv/node/' in
/etc/rsyncd.conf.

Change-Id: I39f70ba9cf4a8c4c068c95667608afafe700f301

subject: Add genconfig tox job for sample config file generation

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-23 19:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add genconfig tox job for sample config file generation

If someone tries to run generate_sample.sh outside a venv
or without installing project dependencies, you could encounter
error messages related to missing or outdated dependencies.

This change wraps generate_sample.sh execution in tox. Wrapping it
in a tox job makes sure all dependencies found in requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt are properly installed prior to its execution.

This change does not propose the removal of the sample config file
already in place in the repository and it does not propose adding
it to the list of jobs automatically ran by tox.

This change is merely the introduction of a more convenient way
to execute generate_sample.sh in a proper venv.

You can now (re)generate the sample config file with this tox job:

  tox -egenconfig

Change-Id: I1058a306a462ba8349a4433c78070fabd6d03e39
'}]
commit_message:
Add genconfig tox job for sample config file generation

If someone tries to run generate_sample.sh outside a venv
or without installing project dependencies, you could encounter
error messages related to missing or outdated dependencies.

This change wraps generate_sample.sh execution in tox. Wrapping it
in a tox job makes sure all dependencies found in requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt are properly installed prior to its execution.

This change does not propose the removal of the sample config file
already in place in the repository and it does not propose adding
it to the list of jobs automatically ran by tox.

This change is merely the introduction of a more convenient way
to execute generate_sample.sh in a proper venv.

You can now (re)generate the sample config file with this tox job:

  tox -egenconfig

Change-Id: I1058a306a462ba8349a4433c78070fabd6d03e39

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 aggregates API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: I67a1b723f37256e8bdfaf38d9f5ad0a4c4d2e53e

commit_message:
Catch ProcessExecutionError in revoke_cert

Catch processExecutionError if revoking the
certificate fails.

This change has been abandoned by Chuck Short, so
I am continuing where he left off (mattoliverau).

Continues abandoned change: 17741

Change-Id: I9714ea8cece87256ff5f9a936286c1da3d628af9
Closes-Bug: #883320
Co-Authored-By: chuck.short@canonical.com

commit_message:
Don't set sqlite_db default

Keystone doesn't use oslo.db's sqlite_db option so there's no need
to set the option. Setting the default was required with
oslo-incubator's db code but it's now optional so we can remove it.

Change-Id: I7a012f40f924f83b878ee325f8ca26bdbdb9ac1d

commit_message:
Provide explicit image create value for test_image_paginate case

Assign an explicit created_at datetime value to image db fixtures,
it be used to fixes race condition in DB driver test_image_paginate
case.

Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add tox.ini

This is required to be able to build and release the project using
the standard infra tools.  Since there currently aren't any unit
test or doc jobs defined for this project, only a very basic
tox.ini is being added.  It can be filled out later as more jobs
are needed.

Change-Id: I121405d4ec82a4d8252098319fce0a9f5b5bfb4f

commit_message:
Added Heat Software Config-Deploy API test

Added functions to base and to the JSON client to support the new API
Added a small test to verify the calls

Added response and body testing to the test itself, not to base.py
I added it there because it keeps base.py less susceptible to changes
and gives me better control

Change-Id: Ied896fcaf3cf4a80385b28235eb5f4af9cd182c8

split original test to 6 smaller ones

Change-Id: I914b37e1cd2cc783fae00a233bfe1acd9c46103c

commit_message:
Instance use nova_utils delete server

Currently Instance uses its own delete task, and Server uses the
delete task in nova_utils.

This change makes Instance use the nova_utils delete task too.

subject: nova_utils.delete_server extra status checks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-25 00:18:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/nova_utils.py'], 'message': 'nova_utils.delete_server extra status checks

This change adds the following to the server delete task:
* Treats status DELETED the same as a NotFound, as in
  Instance._delete_server
* Raises ResourceInError if the server status goes to ERROR

Change-Id: I67e964054df4bdff19e7fb74e871fcb507891f63
'}]
commit_message:
nova_utils.delete_server extra status checks

This change adds the following to the server delete task:
* Treats status DELETED the same as a NotFound, as in
  Instance._delete_server
* Raises ResourceInError if the server status goes to ERROR

Change-Id: I67e964054df4bdff19e7fb74e871fcb507891f63

subject: Avoid usage of mutables as default args
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-23 12:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/exception.py'], 'message': "Avoid usage of mutables as default args

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Id91b53e03c17a19e94830b43fe0c4970c824ff70
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid usage of mutables as default args

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Id91b53e03c17a19e94830b43fe0c4970c824ff70

commit_message:
Don't rely on setdefault returning a value

Workaround a bug in sqlalchemy>=0.9.5 where setdefault doesn't return
the proper value.

Change-Id: Ibc93024f7f41f4ced81525fac42566a18b1c641c
Closes-Bug: #1333556

commit_message:
'policy' should be required in server_group_create

The 'policies' param is a required param in nova api now.
So, we also need to change it in cli.

After the modification, the 'policy' param will be required now,
and the old '--policy' style will still be available.

Change-Id: I97921eef0f635c8d50a04bbdaf3ef4f1bfaa3e9d
Closes-Bug: #1323909

commit_message:
Adds exception handling around heat stack creation

Reasons:
- heat_client.stacks.create raises HTTPException which was not
  captured in heat work-flow.

Changes:
- Adds heat_exceptions.HTTPException in the exceptions captured
  while stack creation.

Change-Id: Ia87e1f6d08ac062e1085dd1c0b0c4197a74597d4
Closes-Bug: #1325049

subject: Ignoring order of user list in TenantTestCase
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9101, 'name': 'wanghong', 'email': 'reviewwanghong@126.com', 'username': 'wanghong'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10281, 'name': 'Priti Desai', 'email': 'pdesai@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'priti_desai'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-23 22:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_v2_controller.py'], 'message': 'Ignoring order of user list in TenantTestCase

keystone.tests.test_v2_controller.TenantTestCase.
test_get_project_users_no_user should not bother asserting
the order of the results, only that the expected values appear in the list.
Replacing self.assertEqual(orig_project_users, new_project_users)
with self.assertEqual(sorted(orig_project_users), sorted(new_project_users))
Better option would be assertItemsEqual but its only available in 2.7 and later.

Closes-bug: #1332831
Change-Id: I09842e0375dc0fa8908241498e1cc794e04d992c
'}]
commit_message:
Ignoring order of user list in TenantTestCase

keystone.tests.test_v2_controller.TenantTestCase.
test_get_project_users_no_user should not bother asserting
the order of the results, only that the expected values appear in the list.
Replacing self.assertEqual(orig_project_users, new_project_users)
with self.assertEqual(sorted(orig_project_users), sorted(new_project_users))
Better option would be assertItemsEqual but its only available in 2.7 and later.

Closes-bug: #1332831
Change-Id: I09842e0375dc0fa8908241498e1cc794e04d992c

commit_message:
Fixed data copy issue of volume/driver.py

I found data copy issue on __init__ of ISERDriver class.
Some settings for iser should be copied to iscsi's.
But iser_port value was copied not to iscsi_port but to iser_port.
This patch will fix this issue as to be copied to iscsi_port.

Change-Id: I7621e690396049aabf3ced331e633158f45067f4

subject: GlusterFS: Handle deletion of snapshot with no backing file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8247, 'name': 'Thang Pham', 'email': 'thang.g.pham@gmail.com', 'username': 'thang.pham'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10725, 'name': 'Sergey Gotliv', 'email': 'sgotliv@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgotliv'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-06-24 21:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'GlusterFS: Handle deletion of snapshot with no backing file

If a glusterfs volume is in-use, nova is called to delete a
volume snapshot.  It is possible for a timeout to occur, since
cinder is polling for nova task progress.  In such case, a
GlusterfsException is thrown, but nova continues to process the
snapshot delete and commits the changes.  Cinder is not aware of
this, and the actual snapshot entry in cinder is prevented from
being deleted, since no backing file exists for the out-of-sync
snapshot.  This patch allows a snapshot with no backing file to
be deleted from cinder and updates the volume info file.

Change-Id: I83c8a7242199edbfd1897297589ac7deb42c5865
Closes-Bug: #1311182
'}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: Handle deletion of snapshot with no backing file

If a glusterfs volume is in-use, nova is called to delete a
volume snapshot.  It is possible for a timeout to occur, since
cinder is polling for nova task progress.  In such case, a
GlusterfsException is thrown, but nova continues to process the
snapshot delete and commits the changes.  Cinder is not aware of
this, and the actual snapshot entry in cinder is prevented from
being deleted, since no backing file exists for the out-of-sync
snapshot.  This patch allows a snapshot with no backing file to
be deleted from cinder and updates the volume info file.

Change-Id: I83c8a7242199edbfd1897297589ac7deb42c5865
Closes-Bug: #1311182

commit_message:
Allow evacuate from vm_state=Error

We currently allow reboot/rebuild/rescue for an instance in the Error state.
This commit allows "evacuate" as well, since it is essentially a "rebuild"
on a different compute node.

This is useful in a number of cases, in particular if an initial evacuation
attempt fails.

Change-Id: I3f513eb738c91fe71767308f57251629639efd6a
Closes-Bug: 1298061

commit_message:
ofagent: move main module from ryu repository

the recent oslo.messaging transition broke ofagent.
this commit fixes the regression.

historically the main module of ofagent has been maintained
in ryu's repository.  this commit moves it into neutron's
repository and add common_config.init() call which is necesary
for the new rpc code.

Closes-Bug: #1332478
Change-Id: Icf215b20cd84ef44b51439e55b1815d72041ba3f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 13:43:36.000000000', 'files': ['manila/scheduler/weights/capacity.py', 'manila/tests/scheduler/test_capacity_weigher.py'], 'message': 'Enable skipped tests from test_capacity_weigher.py

Some tests from  test_capacity_weigher.py were skipped:

- test_capacity_weight_multiplier1
- test_capacity_weight_multiplier2
- test_default_of_spreading_first

because of assertion error when comparing weight of the winner host
with expected value.

Fix this assertions taking into account that weihts of the hosts
are normalised during weighing, so the weight of the winner host
will be 1.0 * weight_multiplier in case of positive weight_multiplier
and 0 in other case.

Make CapacityWeigher able to redefine weight_multiplier from
BaseWeigher.

Closes-Bug: #1329718

Change-Id: I504ae7d980aa063ffddb7f2676e91da4f790e0e4
'}]
commit_message:
Enable skipped tests from test_capacity_weigher.py

Some tests from  test_capacity_weigher.py were skipped:

- test_capacity_weight_multiplier1
- test_capacity_weight_multiplier2
- test_default_of_spreading_first

because of assertion error when comparing weight of the winner host
with expected value.

Fix this assertions taking into account that weihts of the hosts
are normalised during weighing, so the weight of the winner host
will be 1.0 * weight_multiplier in case of positive weight_multiplier
and 0 in other case.

Make CapacityWeigher able to redefine weight_multiplier from
BaseWeigher.

Closes-Bug: #1329718

Change-Id: I504ae7d980aa063ffddb7f2676e91da4f790e0e4

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-06-23 12:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/image/v2/test_images_member_negative.py', 'tempest/services/image/v2/json/image_client.py', 'tempest/api/image/v2/test_images.py', 'tempest/api/image/base.py', 'tempest/api/image/v1/test_images.py', 'tempest/api/image/v2/test_images_tags.py', 'tempest/api/image/v1/test_image_members.py', 'tempest/api/image/v2/test_images_negative.py', 'tempest/api/image/v2/test_images_member.py', 'tempest/api/image/v2/test_images_tags_negative.py', 'tempest/services/image/v1/json/image_client.py'], 'message': 'Add client response checking for image service

Make all api methods on image clients check for the correct response code and
remove response code checking from image tests. There are a few test code
checks outside of the image tests that were not changed. They do no harm and
can be removed when those test files have status codes removed for their own
intended service.

Change existing client checks using resp to resp.status to avoid confusion with
glance http client use of both httplib (raw) and httplib2.

Remove unused replace_membership_list method from v1 client.

Partially implements blueprint client-checks-success

Change-Id: I4ece3db26920454a8e1bd6325ec01ae3d864d0eb
'}]
commit_message:
Add client response checking for image service

Make all api methods on image clients check for the correct response code and
remove response code checking from image tests. There are a few test code
checks outside of the image tests that were not changed. They do no harm and
can be removed when those test files have status codes removed for their own
intended service.

Change existing client checks using resp to resp.status to avoid confusion with
glance http client use of both httplib (raw) and httplib2.

Remove unused replace_membership_list method from v1 client.

Partially implements blueprint client-checks-success

Change-Id: I4ece3db26920454a8e1bd6325ec01ae3d864d0eb

- share-network not provided (positive)
- provided different share-network (negative)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 14:20:10.000000000', 'files': ['bootstrap/sync/etc/init.d/setup-bootdev'], 'message': "Add LINKDELAY to 30s

When spanning tree is enabled on the switches, the first ifup will fail
as the system won't be able to get an address (due to spanning tree does't

commit_message:
Add LINKDELAY to 30s

When spanning tree is enabled on the switches, the first ifup will fail
as the system won't be able to get an address (due to spanning tree does't
allow any traffic for 30s after the port goes UP)

Change-Id: I6595bdca77a4769e858939e936a7ba098c6434b5
Closes-Bug: 1324093

commit_message:
Add LINKDELAY to 30s

When spanning tree is enabled on the switches, the first ifup will fail
as the system won't be able to get an address (due to spanning tree does't
allow any traffic for 30s after the port goes UP)

Change-Id: I6595bdca77a4769e858939e936a7ba098c6434b5
Closes-Bug: 1324093

allow a complete test cycle for create/update/delete methods.

commit_message:
Don't use root_helper when it's not needed

LinuxBridge agent doesn't need to use root_helper when checking if
a device exists. Root priviledges are required to perform operations
inside a namespace and it's not the case here.

Change-Id: I12e0cde2f4dd3b3f8e7f5ed9e90e2805a4466aaa
Closes-bug: #1305800

commit_message:
remove default=None for config options

In the cfg module default=None is set as the default value, so we
do not need to write it again in the code.

Change-Id: I561c3351d87b892f3ead86592cf3b0fdf7f48e96
Closes-Bug: #1323975

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-06-25 01:32:35.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/virt-driver-numa-placement.rst'], 'message': 'Virt driver guest NUMA node placement & topology

This feature aims to enhance the libvirt driver to be able todo
intelligent NUMA node placement for guests. This will increase
the effective utilization of compute resources and decrease
latency by avoiding cross-node memory accesses by guests.

Change-Id: I70fab6d7187ea7be879f9bcfe23809a2380ffa77
'}]
commit_message:
Virt driver guest NUMA node placement & topology

This feature aims to enhance the libvirt driver to be able todo
intelligent NUMA node placement for guests. This will increase
the effective utilization of compute resources and decrease
latency by avoiding cross-node memory accesses by guests.

Change-Id: I70fab6d7187ea7be879f9bcfe23809a2380ffa77

commit_message:
Virt driver guest vCPU topology configuration

This feature aims to give users and administrators the ability to
control the vCPU topology exposed to guests. This enables them to
avoid any of the limitations on vCPU topologies that OS vendors
place on their projects.

Change-Id: I029c98763abedd732c3ea0396dd281bf592ab64a

commit_message:
Set network_scheduler_driver for Midonet plugin

Midonet requires the network_scheduler_driver setting in neutron.conf
in order to handle dhcp port creation. The default we will use for
devstack is the ChanceScheduler.

Change-Id: Ib12cd759b6f2672cb558818193549ac263e5a559
Closes-bug: 1333509

commit_message:
Improve initial documentation

Provide more detailed guidelines based on the info we have in the
wiki at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Guidelines

Provide API documentation for the gettextutils module.

Fix up some formatting issues with the contributing page that kept it
from being included in the table of contents.

Add a description to the README.

Other minor section and document title fixes, and remove unused pages.

Change-Id: I1e0a2be2918fe8f5d4194fc5a82b19edb225c1d0

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9450, 'name': 'Juan Manuel Oll√©', 'email': 'juan.m.olle@intel.com', 'username': 'jmolle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11333, 'name': 'David J Hu', 'email': 'david.hu@hpe.com', 'username': 'dhu'}, {'_account_id': 11387, 'name': 'Sam Leong', 'email': 'chio-fai-sam.leong@hpe.com', 'username': 'Chioleong'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-06-24 18:16:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': 'auth_token cached token handling

auth_token handles tokens that are from its cache, uncached PKI
(compressed and ASN, "offline validation") and UUID/hashed tokens
("online" validation).

For all of these cases, the auth_token middleware was doing

1) expiration check
2) confirm token bind
3) store in cache

In some cases, some of these steps aren't necessary.

When getting the token from the cache
1) no expiration check is needed because the expiration time is
   stored as cache data and the token would be rejected during
   _cache_get.
2) Storing in the cache is unnecessary because the token is
   already in the cache.

When doing online validation, it's not necessary to do the
expiration check because the identity server would have rejected
the token if it was expired.

Closes-Bug: #1289075
Change-Id: I6afa98504215521538434f1f8a2d97585ce35de5
'}]
commit_message:
auth_token cached token handling

auth_token handles tokens that are from its cache, uncached PKI
(compressed and ASN, "offline validation") and UUID/hashed tokens
("online" validation).

For all of these cases, the auth_token middleware was doing

1) expiration check
2) confirm token bind
3) store in cache

In some cases, some of these steps aren't necessary.

When getting the token from the cache
1) no expiration check is needed because the expiration time is
   stored as cache data and the token would be rejected during
   _cache_get.
2) Storing in the cache is unnecessary because the token is
   already in the cache.

When doing online validation, it's not necessary to do the
expiration check because the identity server would have rejected
the token if it was expired.

Closes-Bug: #1289075
Change-Id: I6afa98504215521538434f1f8a2d97585ce35de5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1925, 'name': 'Vipul Sabhaya', 'email': 'vipuls@gmail.com', 'username': 'vipuls'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8214, 'name': 'Auston McReynolds', 'email': 'amcreynolds@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'amcreynolds'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 11783, 'name': 'Shayne Burgess', 'email': 'shayne.burgess@hp.com', 'username': 'shayne-burgess'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-23 23:51:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': 'Use 'sudo install' for conf files instead of 'cp'

In a devstack-gate environment, the devstack user (stack) is used to run
devstack, and so the /etc/trove directory is writable only by the stack
user. This causes kick-start to fail when the ubuntu user tries to copy
the trove-guestagent.conf to the /etc/trove CONF directory.

Fixed this by using "sudo install" instead of a plain "cp" to copy the
config files over to the /etc/trove directory.

Closes-bug: 1333454
Change-Id: Ie2df541b27ceb44d1ec685a313fed19a1f1ca40e
'}]
commit_message:
Use 'sudo install' for conf files instead of 'cp'

In a devstack-gate environment, the devstack user (stack) is used to run
devstack, and so the /etc/trove directory is writable only by the stack
user. This causes kick-start to fail when the ubuntu user tries to copy
the trove-guestagent.conf to the /etc/trove CONF directory.

Fixed this by using "sudo install" instead of a plain "cp" to copy the
config files over to the /etc/trove directory.

Closes-bug: 1333454
Change-Id: Ie2df541b27ceb44d1ec685a313fed19a1f1ca40e

       during kick-start

commit_message:
Update FakeRing and FakeLogger

FakeLogger gets better log level handling

Parameterize logger on some daemons which were previously
unparameterized and try and use the interface in tests.

FakeRing use more real code

The existing FakeRing mock's implementation bit me on some pretty subtle
character encoding issue by-passing the hash_path code that is normally
part of get_part_nodes.  This change tries to exercise more of the real
ring code paths when it makes sense and provide a better Fake for use in
testing.

Add write_fake_ring helper to test.unit for when you need a real ring.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint storage-policies
Change-Id: Id2e3740b1dd569050f4e083617e7dd6a4249027e

commit_message:
Enqueue misplaced objects during container replication

After a container database is replicated, a _post_replicate_hook will enqueue
misplaced objects for the container-reconciler into the .misplaced_objects
containers.  Items to be reconciled are "batch loaded" into the reconciler
queue and the end of a container replication cycle by levering container
replication itself.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint storage-policies
Change-Id: I3627efcdea75403586dffee46537a60add08bfda

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-19 21:41:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Instance and volume cleanup when a build fails

On failed builds the _shutdown_instance method used to get called which
would clean up leftover instance artifacts, volume attachments, and
networking.  This no longer happens which is causing volumes to be left
in an attached state when they're not attached to anything.

Network deallocation is already handled in this code path so it should
not happen in _shutdown_instance.

Change-Id: I899b64ac5941acc282ccae7e1963d6f714c01e8b
Closes-bug: #1332198
"}]
commit_message:
Instance and volume cleanup when a build fails

On failed builds the _shutdown_instance method used to get called which
would clean up leftover instance artifacts, volume attachments, and
networking.  This no longer happens which is causing volumes to be left
in an attached state when they're not attached to anything.

Network deallocation is already handled in this code path so it should
not happen in _shutdown_instance.

Change-Id: I899b64ac5941acc282ccae7e1963d6f714c01e8b
Closes-bug: #1332198

commit_message:
Fix alarm-threshold-update --query option

Currently, alarm-threshold-update command can not update its query
field, because the dest value is removed accidently so the query is
not put under threshold_rule dict. This patch simply adds it back.

Change-Id: I2eeaf8cbb26f506e097dafdcb6d0eae4ad7fec3e
Closes-Bug: #1313676

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-17 14:28:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Use VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_LIVE for paused instances

When a volume is attached to a paused instance, it does not
appear in the instance's block devices list (i.e. lsblk)
after the instance has resumed. A similar situation
happens when detaching a volume from a paused instance; the
block device continues to exists in the block devices list,
where it should not.  It was found that the volume is only
persisted in the domain's config settings and not its active
settings, since only the VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_CONFIG flag was used
on attach and detach volume.  In order to affect the active
settings, the VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_LIVE flag has to be added when
attaching and detaching volumes.

Change-Id: I9c90a410a7ecb91f5a4de28acee21fe7da49242c
Closes-Bug: #1242366
Related-Bug: #1299331
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_LIVE for paused instances

When a volume is attached to a paused instance, it does not
appear in the instance's block devices list (i.e. lsblk)
after the instance has resumed. A similar situation
happens when detaching a volume from a paused instance; the
block device continues to exists in the block devices list,
where it should not.  It was found that the volume is only
persisted in the domain's config settings and not its active
settings, since only the VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_CONFIG flag was used
on attach and detach volume.  In order to affect the active
settings, the VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_LIVE flag has to be added when
attaching and detaching volumes.

Change-Id: I9c90a410a7ecb91f5a4de28acee21fe7da49242c
Closes-Bug: #1242366
Related-Bug: #1299331

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-06-22 21:22:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/auth/test_identity_common.py', 'keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py', 'keystoneclient/httpclient.py', 'keystoneclient/_discover.py'], 'message': 'Unversioned endpoints in service catalog

If you pass a version number to the endpoint_filter then an identity
plugin will make a request to the URL in the service catalog and find an
appropriate URL for the requested version.

It caches the response to each of the discovery queries so that it
should only query once per URL.

This will only work for applications that create session objects
directly as the legacy model does not use the get_endpoint features of
an identity plugin.

This change showed an inconsistency in the docstrings between discovery

commit_message:
Unversioned endpoints in service catalog

If you pass a version number to the endpoint_filter then an identity
plugin will make a request to the URL in the service catalog and find an
appropriate URL for the requested version.

It caches the response to each of the discovery queries so that it
should only query once per URL.

This will only work for applications that create session objects
directly as the legacy model does not use the get_endpoint features of
an identity plugin.

This change showed an inconsistency in the docstrings between discovery
and the usage of discovery so the docstring was fixed.

Blueprint: endpoint-version-query
Change-Id: I277f2f6ad6c8cd44f1a9c06cf07d62bc8f8b383b

commit_message:
Standardize logging for nova.virt.libvirt

 - add log translation hints for warning, error and info levels
 - remove use of % as a string formatter, use the log functionality
   instead
 - move from LOG.warning to LOG.warn

Log translation is motivated by oslo's move to prioritized
translation of strings, as documented at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

Change-Id: I61ab8dbcdb73795538ea9d60c0c9d00c425ee1a5

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-24 23:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/ceph/manifests/conf.pp'], 'message': "Add link to /root/.cephdeploy.conf -> /etc/ceph/ceph.conf

ceph-deploy requires that its local config file (previously $(pwd)/ceph.conf)
is exactly the same as /etc/ceph/ceph.conf on the system or --overwite-conf
has to be specified. Since we need to manipulate it and can't guarantee order
 from Puppet / Ruby we just link to two on the primary-controller to avoid
 the issue.

All additional users of config should config pull with --overwite-conf and
not have this issue.

The old link is left in place at this time to support older versions of
 ceph-deploy and can be removed in a later release.

Closes-bug: #1333814
Change-Id: I0b61c71effcf779801756968b8ed8b8cb93cb54b
"}]
commit_message:
Add link to /root/.cephdeploy.conf -> /etc/ceph/ceph.conf

ceph-deploy requires that its local config file (previously $(pwd)/ceph.conf)
is exactly the same as /etc/ceph/ceph.conf on the system or --overwite-conf
has to be specified. Since we need to manipulate it and can't guarantee order
 from Puppet / Ruby we just link to two on the primary-controller to avoid
 the issue.

All additional users of config should config pull with --overwite-conf and
not have this issue.

The old link is left in place at this time to support older versions of
 ceph-deploy and can be removed in a later release.

Closes-bug: #1333814
Change-Id: I0b61c71effcf779801756968b8ed8b8cb93cb54b
